title: LA Lakers‚Äô stance on Magic Johnson‚Äôs return and Rob Pelinka‚Äôs future revealed
description: The Los Angeles Lakers have clarified their position on Magic Johnson‚Äôs involvement and Rob Pelinka‚Äôs role within the organization. Speculation has intensified about potential front office changes following recent restructuring behind the scenes.
fullText:
The Los Angeles Lakers have clarified their position on Magic Johnson‚Äôs involvement and Rob Pelinka‚Äôs role within the organization.

Speculation has intensified about potential front office changes following recent restructuring behind the scenes.

Questions centred on whether a franchise legend could return in an official capacity and whether leadership at the basketball operations level would shift. The latest update provides firm answers on both fronts.

In comments shared by Dave McMenamin, the organization made its stance clear: ‚ÄúNew Lakers president of business operations, Lon Rosen, told reporters this evening that Rob Pelinka will remain as the team‚Äôs president of basketball operations.‚Äù

The statement removes immediate uncertainty around Pelinka‚Äôs position and signals continuity within the basketball decision-making structure.

Despite external noise and ongoing scrutiny of roster construction, the Lakers appear committed to stability at the top of their sporting hierarchy.

The same update added clarity regarding Earvin Magic Johnson‚Äôs involvement, noting: ‚Äú‚Ä¶While Earvin Magic Johnson will surely be around the franchise, no official title is planned for him with LAL.‚Äù

Magic Johnson remains one of the most influential figures in Lakers history, both as a player and former executive. However, the absence of an official title indicates that any presence will be informal rather than operational.

That distinction matters. While fan sentiment often leans towards symbolic reunions, the Lakers‚Äô leadership structure appears defined and settled for now.

Pelinka retains authority over basketball matters, and Magic Johnson‚Äôs influence will exist outside the executive framework.

The message from Los Angeles is straightforward. Stability remains the priority, and any legacy involvement will not disrupt the current chain of command.

title: Harry Kane could equal another Bundesliga record for Bayern Munich in Der Klassiker
description: FC Bayern + Harry Kane = Broken Records.
fullText:
Not only does Harry Kane score goals for fun, he also breaks records for fun. This season, Kane became the fastest player to reach 20 goal contributions in Europe‚Äôs top five leagues, needing just 742 minutes, pipping Messi‚Äôs previous record of 749 in the 2011/12 season. The Englishman also scored his 100th goal for Bayern in 104 games, beating Cristiano Ronaldo and Erling Haaland as the fastest player to score 100 goals for one club. Kane is by no means a one-season-wonder either. He became the first player in the Bundesliga‚Äôs 60 year history to score over 20 goals in their first three seasons. And just in case that wasn‚Äôt enough, the Englishman has converted all 23 of his attempted spot-kicks‚Äîthe longest 100% conversion rate in the league‚Äôs history.

Kane could make history once again in Bayern‚Äôs clash against bitter rivals, Borussia Dortmund. The Three Lions captain has scored multiple goals in each of his last three Bundesliga matches, a feat matched only by Gerd M√ºller and Robert Lewandowski‚Äîthe latter scoring multiple goals in four consecutive games, a record Kane could equal.

3 ‚Äì For the third time, Bayern Munich‚Äôs Harry Kane scored multiple goals in three consecutive Bundesliga matches ‚Äì in Bundesliga history, only Robert Lewandowski has done this more often (4 times), while Gerd M√ºller also achieved it 3 times. Triple.

It‚Äôs no secret Kane is slowly reeling Lewandowski‚Äôs Bundesliga goal record in, but equaling‚Äîand potentially breaking‚Äîanother of the Pole‚Äôs records would be the cherry on top of what has already been a record-breaking, career-defining season.

title: Patriots' Mike Vrabel Focusing On This Position Group At NFL Combine
description: New England Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel admitted to primarily focusing on this position group at the 2026 NFL Scouting Combine.
fullText:
Patriots' Mike Vrabel Focusing On This Position Group At NFL Combine originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

New England Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel is taking a trip down memory lane at the 2026 NFL Scouting Combine...

Vrabel, speaking with media at Lucas Oil Stadium on Wednesday, admitted that he was spending the majority of his time in meetings with edge players since arriving on Sunday.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve met with a bunch of edge players," Vrabel said, per team-provided video. "There‚Äôs depth there. So, we‚Äôll continue to work our way across the board and enjoy these meetings.‚Äù

It's important to note that the schedule likely has a lot to do with that singular focus, though some high-profile prospects have confirmed that they have met with the club: Texas A&M's Cashius Howell and Missouri's Zion Young.

The Patriots can meet with pretty much anyone they want at this point, with the final position group (offensive line) scheduled to be made available on Thursday, so it is notable that they continue to do work on prospects who could potentially solve their pass-rush problem throughout Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday.

Will it actually lead to a significant interest once the 2026 NFL Draft comes around in April? It'll remain to be seen.

title: NASCAR's Dover All Star Race format requires a calculator
description: There will be inverts that determine the final stage and eliminations
fullText:
In its first year being held at Dover Motor Speedway, the NASCAR All-Star Race now has a format to be contested under the shadow of Miles the Monster.

And this one is going to be a marathon that requires a good bit of arithmetic.

First and foremost, there will no longer be an ‚Äòopen‚Äô race for drivers not already locked-in to race their way into the decisive segment of the event. With modern Dover races being 400 laps, NASCAR landed on 350 to honor those who annually attend at The Monster Mile.

Every driver that enters the All-Star Race will start the event but there are already 17 drivers currently locked into the third and final stage of the event -- William Byron, Kyle Larson, Christopher Bell, Denny Hamlin, Chase Elliott, Tyler Reddick, Brad Keselowski, Joey Logano, Austin Cindric, Ryan Blaney, Josh Berry, Austin Dillon, Chase Briscoe, Ross Chastain, Shane Van Gisbergen, Bubba Wallace and Kyle Busch.

The eligibility is determined by the following criteria:

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Winners of points paying races in 2025 or 2026

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Previous All Star Race winners still racing full-time

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Previous NASCAR Cup Series champions still racing full-time

The final stage will include 26 drivers racing for the $1 million prize. The combined results of stage 1 and 2 will get the field to 25 drivers with the 26th and final spot being awarded to the traditional fan vote winner.

After the first stage, which is 75 laps, NASCAR will invert the top-26 finishers meaning that 26th will start first for the second stage and 25th will start second and so-forth. After the next 75 laps., which is the second stage, the lowest combined finishing positions from both segments will determine the starting lineup for the final 200 lap segment.

Drivers already locked-in cannot be eliminated. Up to the 25th starting spot will be determined by the drivers not yet locked-in. The starting lineup for the final segment will be determined by average finish across the first two stages.

Qualifying on Saturday will set the starting lineup for the first stage. The pit crew contest will also continue to be part of the qualifying format.

Drivers will take the green flag, run one full lap at speed, and on the second lap proceed to the designated pit stall for a four-tire stop with no fuel. Once the stop has been completed, the car will take off from the stall and race to the checkered flag. The qualifying time will be the total elapsed time from green flag to checkered flag, with the fastest team earning the pole position for the race.

The pit crew contest winner will be determined by the fastest pit stop, with timing line established as one box behind and one box ahead of the NASCAR-designated pit stop box. The results of the pit crew contest will determine pit box selection for the race on Sunday.

To read more Motorsport.com articles visit our website.

title: A towering rookie season puts Brewers' Jacob Misiorowski in the national spotlight
description: The Brewers' flamethrower is looking to make the most of his second season.
fullText:
A towering rookie season puts Brewers' Jacob Misiorowski in the national spotlight originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Jacob Misiorowski first started to make a name for himself as a high school athlete in Missouri. By his junior year, he was throwing bullpens in front of MLB scouts.

Going into his senior year, his baseball season would be cancelled due to COVID-19, and the shortened draft that year did not help the hard-throwing righty's chances.

He would go on to play college baseball at Crowder College. After redshirting his freshman year, he was lights out in 2022 and threw another bullpen in front of big league scouts, where he averaged 99.8 mph.

MORE:¬†Brewers should cash in on their Mets connection to land a 27-homer threat

The Milwaukee Brewers, being impressed with the easy velocity, selected him with the 63rd overall pick in the 2022 MLB Draft, and he started to fly up the prospect ranking.

Last year, he sat as the club's No. 3 prospect, and he would go on to make his MLB debut in June.

He was fantastic last season. He appeared in 15 games, putting together a 5-3 record with a 4.36 ERA, which led to him being voted an All-Star last season.

He will be one to watch, especially with Freddy Peralta gone. Bleacher Report's Joel Reuter has faith he can continue to dominate and tags him as the 20th best player under 25 years old.

"It was an up-and-down first big league season for Misiorowski, highlighted by a surprise All-Star selection and a stellar run as a multi-inning reliever in October. The towering 6'7" right-hander now looks like the clear No. 2 on the Milwaukee staff following the Freddy Peralta trade, and he is more than capable of answering the bell."

However, if Misiorowski wants to serve as a legitimate No. 2, he needs to work on his walk rate and develop a third pitch. He finished the year hovering around an 11 percent walk rate, while hitters will key in on him being a primary two-pitch pitcher.

Limiting his walks and continuing to work on his changeup could really put him in a different tier when it comes to young arms.

title: 10 Prospects Patriots Should Watch For At 2026 NFL Scouting Combine
description: The New England Patriots have plenty of needs entering the offseason, and might look toward these prospects to potentially fill them ahead of the 2026 NFL Draft.
fullText:
10 Prospects Patriots Should Watch For At 2026 NFL Scouting Combine originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

It's the most wonderful time of the year!

The New England Patriotshave officially started preparations for the 2026 NFL Draft, as they‚Äôll spend the remainder of the week getting eyes on the best and brightest of the upcoming class out at the NFL Scouting Combine in Indianapolis ‚Äî the schedule of which is as follows:

2026 NFL Scouting Combine
Thursday, Feb. 26 (3-8 p.m. ET): DL, LB
Friday, Feb. 27 (3-8 p.m. ET): DB, TE
Saturday, Feb. 28 (1-8 p.m. ET): QB, WR, RB
Sunday, March 1 (1-5 p.m. ET): OL

Mike Vrabel and Eliot Wolf both spoke before on-field workouts began on Thursday, and helped give some clues as to what they‚Äôll be looking for out of prospects that will take the field over the weekend.

It‚Äôs clear that there will be a focus on adding athleticism and pass-rush production on the defensive side of the ball, while some specific spots on the roster are clearly in need of an influx of talent ‚Äî which brings us to these players in particular that the organization should keep an eye on:

Hilton was supposed to be in first-round conversations, as he began his collegiate career rated ahead of Malik Nabers, Brian Thomas Jr. and Jack Bech when they all arrived on campus at LSU in 2021 -- as well as future first-round picks Xavier Worthy and Marvin Harrison Jr.

It's safe to say that didn't happen, though you can't necessarily blame the player.

Hilton dealt with several injuries that ultimately ended three of his five seasons, but his elite track background (three-time state champion high jumper in Louisiana) and potential to come away from this event with the fastest 40-yard dash time (clocked at 22.13 mph in 2024) make him one of the most fascinating prospects who will work out this weekend. It's believed that he could rocket up draft boards with an elite performance, though he's still likely to be available on Day 3.

New England needs to add proven production at wide receiver, but after they do that, perhaps there's value in rolling the dice on someone who never quite lived up to the expectations set out for him at LSU -- after all, it did work out pretty well with Kayshon Boutte.

No, this isn't going to turn into one of those jokes about how a certain type of wide receiver always seems to find success at One Patriot Place...

Wetjen might kind of look like Julian Edelman, Wes Welker, Danny Amendola and Efton Chism III, but you aren't drafting him with the expectation that he'll turn into your next great slot receiver -- he'd make the roster based off his special teams acumen alone.

Wetjen is built like a running back (5-foot-9, 196 pounds) and listed as a wide receiver (23 career receptions), but his value comes in the kicking game. Iowa has sort of made a name developing guys like this, but there's no doubt who has been the best of the best, with the hybrid kick/punt returner leading the nation with 1,203 kick return yards, 891 punt return yards and six total return touchdowns across 2024 and 2025.

The Patriots need somebody to return kicks after releasing Antonio Gibson and presumably saying goodbye to D'Ernest Johnson, especially if there is still some trepidation about filling that role with the likes of TreVeyon Henderson or Kyle Williams. I can't imagine someone better suited for the role than this young man.

HE'S GONE‚ÄºÔ∏è

Kaden Wetjen returns it 8Ô∏è‚É£5Ô∏è‚É£ yards for the @HawkeyeFootball TD.#B1GFootball on @BigTenNetwork üì∫ pic.twitter.com/GJDJevZTV5

‚Äî Big Ten Football (@B1Gfootball) October 26, 2024

IT'S TIME TO INVEST AT TIGHT END!

Hunter Henry was really good this past season, but he's entering the final year of his contract and is on the wrong side of 30. Austin Hooper is going to be an unrestricted free agent, and is on the wrong side of 30. Jack Westover is going to be a restricted free agent, and perhaps the only reason he'll be back is because he is on the right side of 30.

It's genuinely insane that this organization hasn't thought about life after it moves on from this current crop of talent at the position...

I'd imagine they finally invest heavily at the position this offseason, something that was referred to by Vrabel on Wednesday, which means signing one of the many good options available in free agency (Isaiah Likely, David Njoku, Cade Otton¬†and Chig Okonkwo) and¬†drafting someone who could potentially develop into the future top option.

Koziol is as good an option as any, as he possesses good size (6-foot-6, 245 pounds), has been productive (168 receptions and 14 touchdowns across 2024 and 2025) and would likely fall into your lap in the middle rounds (No. 3 TE, according to ESPN's Mel Kiper Jr.). I don't think he's going to transform the way this team plays football, but he's a functional second option at the position... and you need one of those.

Bentley is another good option if you're just looking for a high-floor guy who can play behind someone else, though he could give you a bit more of a bang for your buck.

Bentley exploded onto the scene this past season, finishing with 46 receptions, 620 receiving yards and six touchdowns -- just barely scraping by his previous career total of 3-20-0. Utah helped him put it all together by getting him the ball on underneath routes and allowing him to showcase his abilities after the catch, which is extremely impressive for someone who checks in at 6-foot-3, 262 pounds.

How many people can do a backflip at that size?

I've seen teams fall in love with a lot less.

If you're looking for functional athleticism, this is your guy.

Louis will test well over the weekend, but nothing he does will be all that surprising given what we've seen in game situations: he once blocked an extra point and returned it for the rare two-point conversion, had six interceptions and double-digit sacks across the last two seasons, was clocked as the fastest player on his team, etc.

The Patriots need to add speed to the second level and quite literally can't do any better than this hybrid player who has displayed shades of greatness.

Perkins actually might be faster...

It's really difficult to evaluate him, however, as he has been insanely productive when healthy (35.5 tackles for loss, 17.0 sacks, five interceptions) but also has a season-ending injury under his belt and is extremely undersized (6-foot, 222 pounds).

The NFL very rarely gets it right with those kinds of players, but you can bet that someone will think they can figure it out given his undeniable talent. If they're right, they'll look like geniuses. If they're wrong, well... we'll all point and laugh.

4Ô∏è‚É£ sacks
2Ô∏è‚É£ forced fumbles

Harold Perkins Jr. is a PROBLEM üò§ @LSUfootballpic.twitter.com/KxSOEvdC3f

‚Äî SEC Network (@SECNetwork) November 12, 2022

Hill will almost certainly be gone by the time the Patriots are picking at No. 63, as he falls under the category of surefire starter at an undervalued position. It's the absolute worst place to be for a prospect (less money, virtually no guarantees) and the best place to be for a team (less money, virtually no guarantees).

If they're feeling like trading back, however...

Hill has enough versatility to drop back into coverage while occasionally rushing the passer, though that archetype often gets teams into trouble as they try to pigeonhole those players into pure pass-rush roles. Micah Parsons is an example of someone who that worked with. Edgerrin Cooper, Troy Andersen, Jamin Davis and Kenneth Murray are examples of the opposite.

I'd imagine you've heard this name before.

Young is that guy who has been linked to New England ever since folks started really paying attention to prospects following Super Bowl LX.

It's safe to say there is no bigger need than the addition of pass-rush production, and no one really seems to care how they go about obtaining it -- whether that be trading for someone like Maxx Crosby, signing someone like Trey Hendrickson or letting the chips fall where they may and drafting one of the options that remains available during the second round like Young.

If you want to swing for the fences, this is the guy you do it for...

Faulk will likely be gone by the time the Patriots pick at No. 31, but there could be opportunities to move up and grab -- or sit and wait for -- someone who looks (6-foot-6, 290 pounds)and acts (16.0 tackles for loss and 9.0 sacks across 2024 and 2025) the part.

Faulk isn't the flashiest option, but his versatility and ability to be disruptive on every single down is really exciting to think about -- especially if you can envision what it would look like alongside Crosby/Hendrickson, Milton Williams and Christian Barmore.

title: Bord consortium pull out of Sheff Wed takeover
description: A consortium led by former professional poker player James Bord pulls out of a takeover of Sheffield Wednesday
fullText:
A consortium led by former professional poker player James Bord has pulled out of a proposed ¬£47.8m takeover of Sheffield Wednesday.

The consortium of Bord, Felix Romer and Alsharif Faisal Bin Jamil was named as the preferred bidder for the Championship club on 24 December.

"To all the long-suffering fans of this great club, it is with the greatest regret that we have decided not to pursue our bid to become your new custodians," said a statement released by the consortium on Wednesday.

"The historic mishandling of the club and pattern of catastrophic underinvestment means our sizeable binding bid can no longer be justified.

"We have spent over ¬£4m to help run the club over the last two months and, after much consideration, have decided that we can no longer continue to do so.

"We know this will be a bitter disappointment to many ‚Äì who hoped the ownership saga would soon be over ‚Äì and for this we can only apologise wholeheartedly.

"We know the rest of your season is going to be challenging, as will the next, but you will rise again to your former glory and when you do, we will be cheering your success."

The Owls have been in administration since October after 10 years under the ownership of Dejphon Chansiri.

They were relegated from the Championship on Sunday following a 2-1 defeat at city rivals Sheffield United. It was the earliest-ever relegation in English football.

Administrators Begbies Traynor chose the Bord group after it paid a non-refundable deposit of ¬£2.5m.

The trio have been going through the owners and directors' test with the EFL and the new Independent Football Regulator since then.

BBC Sport understands the due diligence process had been particularly challenging.

Significant amounts of documentation was still outstanding at the time the preferred bidder withdrew.

It has been funding the club's losses since then to the tune of about ¬£1m a month.

A further payment was due this week to extend the preferred bidder status by a further two weeks.

But the group has pulled out because the club's valuation is now considered to be lower than the ¬£47.8m originally offered and the consortium are unable to negotiate down, as per the terms of their agreement.

It leaves administrators needing to find another buyer.

In a statement, Sheffield Wednesday's joint administrators said: "The withdrawal of this bidder does not mean we are returning to the beginning of the process.

"We have already been contacted by other parties who previously participated in the sales process and who have reiterated their interest in acquiring the club.

"We are therefore moving immediately to re-engage with those bidders under a new expedited timetable."

Adding that the focus on getting the club out of administration and securing its long-term future remains in place, it continued: "We understand that this news will be disappointing and frustrating for supporters.

"However, the club remains operational, funded for the remainder of the season, and interest in the acquisition remains active."

BBC Sport understands the Bord bid was significantly higher than any other interested parties - and that no other bid matched the requirement for 25p in the pound for creditors.

If the new owners do not pay 25p in the pound, the EFL's insolvency policy states the club must start the following season with a 15-point deduction.

The Owls have already been docked 18 points this season for financial infringements under Chansiri.

Former Crystal Palace owner Simon Jordan, who at one stage was involved in a consortium which was considering a bid, says that automatic 15-point penalty should be challenged.

On Tuesday, another consortium led by American businessman David Storch stated it was still interested.

"We remain incredibly passionate about the opportunity at Sheffield Wednesday and seeing the club return to its former glory," the statement read.

"We wish the preferred bidder well through the process but are ready to step in should the opportunity present itself again.

"We know all are disappointed by relegation yet wish the team well as they finish the current season."

title: Fantasy Football Video: Which team might benefit the most by signing free agent QB Malik Willis?
description: Matt Harmon, Justin Boone and Jori Epstein discuss the pending free agency of QB Malik Willis and where his best fit would be for fantasy football.
fullText:
The QB market this offseason is looking pretty thin as we approach NFL free agency, which is set to begin on March 11 with the legal tampering period opening on March 9. One of the top names on the signal-caller list is Malik Willis, who has spent the past two seasons as Jordan Love‚Äôs backup on the Green Bay Packers.

Reports are suggesting Willis could get at least $30 million per season on his next contract. That would put him at the low-end among starting veteran QBs, just below names like Baker Mayfield and Super Bowl champion Sam Darnold.

We‚Äôve seen Willis perform well in a small sample filling in for Love, making three spot starts while appearing in 11 total games. In those appearances, Willis has posted great numbers, including a 134.6 passer rating and 78.7 completion percentage on just 89 attempts. He has also carried the ball 42 times for 261 yards and three touchdowns.

Will an opportunity to start for a new team give Willis the tools to be a top fantasy football contributor in 2026? Matt Harmon and Justin Boone are joined by Yahoo senior NFL reporter Jori Epstein at the scouting combine to discuss Willis‚Äô future on the latest Yahoo Fantasy Forecast.

Epstein immediately points to Miami as a potential match, looking like ‚ÄúPackers South‚Äù after hiring former Green Bay DC Jeff Hafley as head coach after the season. Former Packers exec John Eric Sullivan was also hired as general manager, so both are familiar with Willis from their time in Green Bay.

The Dolphins would have to move on from QB Tua Tagovailoa, who was benched late in 2025 and has had serious injury issues throughout his NFL career. He‚Äôs also on a lofty contract Miami could try and get out from under.

The other team Epstein mentions is the Arizona Cardinals, who just hired Mike LaFleur, brother of Packers head coach Matt LaFleur. The Cardinals have a similar situation with their incumbent QB in Kyler Murray, who was essentially benched for Jacoby Brissett last season. Murray is also expected not to return to Arizona similar to Tua in Miami. If that‚Äôs the case, Mike could call up his brother and get some intel on Willis as a potential starter.

Boone points out that Arizona wasn‚Äôt very good last season, which resulted in Brissett having to throw the ball a ton. He attempted just over 40 passes per game in 12 starts. That volume really buoyed TE Trey McBride, leading to his mammoth season, along with other pass-catchers like Michael Wilson. If Willis is the starting QB, that would likely mean regression for Cardinals‚Äô pass-catchers.

Harmon questions both teams‚Äô ability to eat so much dead cap space if they end up cutting ties with their respective QBs in Murray and Tagovailoa, which could make it tough to then go and sign Willis. But there are also ties with Cardinals GM Monti Ossenfort, who was with the Tennessee Titans when the team drafted Willis in the third round in 2022.

Wherever Willis lands, it will have fantasy ramifications for his new teammates and how we view them in 2026 drafts.

title: Cubs get brutal Tyler Austin Spring Training injury news
description: Austin spent the past six seasons in Japan.
fullText:
Cubs get brutal Tyler Austin Spring Training injury news originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Chicago Cubs will have to make do without one of their offseason signings for an extended period of time.

According to Maddie Lee of the Chicago Sun-Times, Cubs manager Craig Counsell told reporters that first baseman/outfielder Tyler Austin will be out for "months" following surgery on his patellar tendon in his right knee.

Austin, 34, signed a one-year contract with Chicago in December after a six-year stint with the Yokohama DeNA BayStars in Nippon Professional Baseball. He made his Major League debut in 2016 with the New York Yankees, playing parts of three seasons with the AL East club.

From 2018-19, Austin split time between the Minnesota Twins, San Francisco Giants, and Milwaukee Brewers. He compiled a .219/.292/.451 slash line with 33 home runs and a .743 OPS in 583 Major League plate appearances.

After connecting for 85 homers across six seasons in NPB, Austin had a more than solid chance of breaking camp on the Cubs' Opening Day roster as bench depth.

Without a solidified backup first baseman behind Michael Busch, 22-year-old Moises Ballesteros emerges as one of Chicago's top options for the role. Outfielder and recent minor league signee Michael Conforto is also a candidate to take Austin's roster spot.

Conforto, 32, is coming off the worst season of his 10-year career, hitting just .199 with 12 home runs and a strikeout percentage of 24.9 in 138 games with the Los Angeles Dodgers.

title: New Documentary Highlights UCLA Women‚Äôs Basketball Final Four Run
description: FOX Sports is releasing a new one-hour documentary called ‚ÄúYOU SEE L.A.‚Äù that will highlight UCLA women‚Äôs basketball historic run to the Final Four last season. It was the Bruins‚Äô first trip to the Final Four in the NCAA era,‚Ä¶
fullText:
FOX Sports is releasing a new one-hour documentary called ‚ÄúYOU SEE L.A.‚Äù that will highlight UCLA women‚Äôs basketball historic run to the Final Four last season. It was the Bruins‚Äô first trip to the Final Four in the NCAA era, and the first time UCLA earned the No. 1 seed in the NCAA Tournament in program history.

The documentary will premiere on March 1, 2026, at 5:00 PM PST on FS1 after UCLA‚Äôs rivalry game against USC at the Galen Center. The premiere will also kickoff the month of March, which is Women‚Äôs History Month.

‚ÄúYOU SEE L.A. reflects the kind of storytelling that is core to FOX Sports, stories that capture the emotion, humanity and cultural impact of sports. This film is not only about a remarkable season on the court, but also about leadership, community, the power of women‚Äôs sports, and the resolve of a team representing something bigger than themselves. We‚Äôre proud to share a story that reflects the heart of this team and this city to audiences nationwide,‚Äù said FOX Sports Vice President Barry Nugent.

The documentary explores how UCLA‚Äôs history, including the teachings of legendary coach John Wooden, continues to inspire new generations. It will highlight all the different people who have contributed to building a glorious UCLA women‚Äôs basketball program.

‚ÄúThis film shines a light on the strongest part of UCLA Women‚Äôs Basketball: our people,‚Äù UCLA coach Cori Close said. ‚ÄúYOU SEE L.A. celebrates the character, courage, and competitive fire that defined last season, and I couldn‚Äôt be more proud for the world to witness the humanity behind our success.‚Äù

FOX Sports is collaborating with AV8 Productions, Allez! Sports and Reese Witherspoon‚Äôs Hello Sunshine to produce ‚ÄúYOU SEE L.A.‚Äù

The list of producers includes several well-known names from both the sports and entertainment world.

Some of the executive producers are Jeff Luini, Kelsey Trainor, Harshal Dave, Alan Bloom, Chandler DeWitt, Ally Davis, Melissa Forman, Brad Zager, Barry Nugent, Sara Rea and Sue Kinkead. Producers like Ariana Rotstein, Carl Hansen, Michael Vayder and Rita O‚ÄôDea also helped create the documentary.

‚ÄúThis special is a testament to the resilience, drive, and brilliance of the remarkable athletes and coaches at UCLA. At AV8 Productions, our mission is simple: support great storytellers. YOU SEE L.A. reflects that belief, and we‚Äôre proud to stand behind the team bringing this story to life with FOX Sports,‚Äù said CEO of AV8 Productions Harshal Dave. ‚ÄúWe believe stories like these have the power to inspire the next generation of women in sports and beyond. The UCLA women‚Äôs basketball team is creating a legacy for the future of their program, and we are honored to help bring that legacy to the world.‚Äù

The full trailer is available to watch on YouTube.

The post New Documentary Highlights UCLA Women‚Äôs Basketball Final Four Run appeared first on LA Sports Report.

title: New Browns coach Todd Monken has praise for QB Shedeur Sanders
description: The Browns are looking at a full competition at quarterback this offseason.
fullText:
The question of who will start at quarterback for the Cleveland Browns has a wrinkle to it: There‚Äôs a new coaching staff.

The staff that gave Shedeur Sanders seven starts last season when Sanders was a rookie is gone. Todd Monken, who was the Baltimore Ravens‚Äô offensive coordinator last season, was hired to become Cleveland‚Äôs new head coach.

There‚Äôs a full offseason to go, in terms of acquiring new players in trades, free agency or the draft. The quarterback landscape in Cleveland could change. But Monken, meeting with the media at the NFL scouting combine on Wednesday, had positive things to say about Sanders.

[Get more Browns news: Cleveland team feed]

‚ÄúI think what you see is elite playmaking ability,‚Äù Monken said at the combine. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs in him. You‚Äôve seen it, we‚Äôve seen it, you saw it in college, you saw it on tape last year. Sure there‚Äôs a ways to go, but what rookie isn‚Äôt? What first-year player doesn‚Äôt have a long way to go? I‚Äôm excited to get started with him and all of our quarterbacks and all of our players.‚Äù

Sanders was up and down as a rookie after a highly publicized fall in the draft. He had seven touchdowns and 10 interceptions, and general manager Andrew Berry pointed out at the combine on Tuesday that he had to cut down on mistakes.

That progression, and the Browns‚Äô offseason moves, could determine if Sanders gets more starts next season. Monken said he didn‚Äôt think it was necessarily important to add more quarterbacks in the offseason, but he said the team will do it‚Äôs due diligence at the position.

As is, the team‚Äôs three options seem to be Sanders, fellow 2025 rookie Dillon Gabriel and Deshaun Watson, who the team refuses to rule out as an option.

‚ÄúI think anytime you have a player that at one time has exhibited the skill set at an elite level I think you‚Äôre always going to give them the benefit of the doubt that somehow we might be able to get that out of him again,‚Äù Monken said about Watson.

That‚Äôs not a great quarterback room, but the Browns also don‚Äôt have a great path to adding a better rookie quarterback in the draft, and there are limited options in free agency too.

If the Browns‚Äô quarterback room doesn‚Äôt change, there‚Äôs clearly no leader at the moment to start next season.

‚ÄúSure, I think it‚Äôs an open competition,‚Äù Monken said. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know why it wouldn‚Äôt be an open competition, and I don‚Äôt mean to say that harshly. But I don‚Äôt think there‚Äôs enough on film over the last couple of years one way or the other to say, ‚ÄòBoy, we have a starter at quarterback.‚Äô‚Äù

The Browns will evaluate whoever is on the roster over offseason practices and Monken said he‚Äôd like to have a starter in mind by training camp. But right now, he didn‚Äôt know if he‚Äôd be able to name a starter by then.

‚ÄúYou would hope that‚Äôs the case, you‚Äôd hope that by the time you get to training camp, the reps you‚Äôre giving to a quarterback are for your starter,‚Äù Monken said. ‚ÄúWhether we get to that place, I don‚Äôt know. That will be determined in the offseason.‚Äù

fullText:
The New York high school boys basketball 2025-26 campaign is closing in on the postseason.

For most of the New York high school boys basketball season, remaining at the top of the weekly rankings are the Archbishop Stepinac¬†Crusaders, which are currently 22-4 on the season and are currently riding a 16-game winning streak. Besides the unstoppable Crusaders, but who else should we watch for out of New York when it comes to the state‚Äôs top high school boys basketball squads?

The¬†Massey Ratings, officially used during the BCS era, is a model that ranks sports teams by analyzing game outcomes, strength of schedule, and margin of victory.

Here‚Äôs a way-too-early look at the top 25 teams in the country according to the¬†Massey Ratings, which ranks teams by analyzing game outcomes, strength of schedule and margin of victory, as of Feb. 25.

The¬†Archbishop Stepinac¬†Crusaders (22-4) haven‚Äôt lost a game since Dec. 27 to Montverde Academy (Fla.). This season, the Crusaders senior-laden bunch has led the way and shown off their talent in the front and back court. Senior four-star shooting guard¬†Jasiah Jervis¬†returns after averaging a team-high 16.2 points per game last season. The Crusaders will be tough to drive to the rim on as they have a pair of USC commits in 7-footers in¬†Adonis¬†and¬†Darius Ratliff, respectively. Fordham commitment¬†Hassan Koureissi¬†pairs up with Jervis to create one of the best guard combos in the Northeast. The Crusaders last week notched a pair of blowout wins over Msgr Scanlan and Cardinal Hayes, which the latter was for the 2026 New York Diocesan Championship.

The¬†Long Island Lutheran¬†Crusaders (8-10) have been below the .500 mark the last few weeks, but have played some of the top competition in the country. What is obvious when taking a look at the talent pool the Crusaders possesses, this team can compete with practically anyone in the nation. Long Island Lutheran has multiple five-star talents in senior 6-foot-5 point guard¬†Dylan Mingo¬†and junior 6-foot-8 forward¬†Moussa Kamissoko. Among other players folks need to have their eyes on that lace ‚Äôem up for the Crusaders are Cincinnati commitment¬†Kayden Allen¬†and North Texas pledge¬†TJ Crumble. Long Island Lutheran lost a 66-63 heartbreaker to¬†Brewster Academy¬†(NH), but bounced back with a 57-50 win over¬†Oak Hill Academy.

The¬†Cardinal Hayes¬†Cardinals (17-7) recently saw their three-game winning streak snapped against¬†Holy Cross¬†in a 67-52 decision. The Cardinals most impressive win of the season came against¬†Iona Preparatory School¬†in a 80-74 decision. The Cardinals saw their season come to an end in a 67-51 loss to Archbishop Stepinac for the 2026 New York Diocesan Championship.

The¬†St. Francis Preparatory School¬†Terriers (18-5) have continued with their winning ways as they return one of the more talented teams in the New York City region. Key players returning for the Terriers begins with¬†Oesoemana Sacko, who is already committed to Fairfield University, and 6-foot-3 sophomore¬†Justin DeSena. The Terriers‚Äô only five losses on the season have come against Colorado‚Äôs No. 1 ranked¬†Ralston Valley, No. 3¬†Christ The King Regional¬†(twice), No. 6¬†Nazareth and No. 22 Msgr Scanlan, respectively. St. Francis Preparatory most recent game was a 101-98 loss to Christ The King Regional.

The¬†Nazareth¬†Kingsmen (17-8) of Brooklyn remains in the Top 5 of our latest New York high school boys basketball rankings, though their season came to an end last week in a loss to Holy Cross. Of Nazareth‚Äôs eight losses this season, two of them have come against¬†Archbishop Molloy, but the Kingsmen were able to notch their first victory versus the Stanners. The Kingsmen recently notched an impressive 67-52 victory over No. 3¬†St. Francis Prep.

title: Dubois refuses world champion Wardley's fist bump
description: Daniel Dubois refuses a fist bump from world champion Fabio Wardley at a lively news conference in London to promote their world title fight in May.
fullText:
Daniel Dubois refused a fist bump from world champion Fabio Wardley as the pair came face-to-face at a lively news conference in London.

The world title fight between two of Britain's biggest punchers takes place at Manchester's Co-op Live Arena on 9 May.

After some long-winded bickering between the two camps, the fighters - relatively restrained until that point - finally sparked into life.

Wardley said he would "flatten" the challenger. "My power is proven. If there's time left on the clock, I'm taking you out of the fight," he added.

The 31-year-old - with 19 stoppages in 20 wins - will make the first defence of his WBO crown, having claimed the 'interim' title against Joseph Parker before being upgraded to full champion when Oleksandr Usyk vacated the belt.

Former IBF champion Dubois, 28, is coming off a devastating knockout loss to generational great Usyk last summer.

"If you look back, when it gets dicey, he's not up for it," Wardley said of Dubois, who has faced accusations of folding too easily in his three stoppage defeats.

Wednesday's news conference took place at Dutch Hall, a converted 16th-century church tucked away in the heart of the city.

Dubois - never one for lengthy monologues - kept his answers short and matter of fact.

But the Londoner was clear in his intention. "Victory by knockout, by any means necessary," he said.

When the fighters eventually stepped forward for the obligatory face-off, Dubois looked away first as Wardley smirked.

Moments later Wardley extended his fist in a gesture of respect, but Dubois shook his head and refused to engage.

Before the face-off drama, a twitchy, stone-faced Dubois glanced around at the stained-glass windows as the managers went toe-to-toe backing their men.

Dubois' representative Sam Jones predicted his fighter would "flatten" Ipswich's Wardley in quick time.

Wardley's manager Michael Ofo responded in kind, saying Wardley would "destroy Daniel Dubois early".

The back-and-forth rumbled on, Wardley grinning as the volume increased.

Ofo referenced Dubois' team and the recent changes in his training set-up. After the loss to Usyk, Dubois - who has worked with five trainers in his pro career - briefly parted ways with coach Don Charles before swiftly reversing the decision.

"It's going to be hard for Daniel to overcome all the things going on in his camp," Ofo said.

"The only person over there should be Stan [Dubois' father] because we know he makes all the decisions."

Charles responded that "talk is cheap" before launching into his own war of words.

After all that verbal sparring, promoter Frank Warren restored a little order.

"The winner of this will be fighting in a big stadium fight," the Queensberry boss said.

"But to get there, they have to lace them up and we'll see who is the best on the night.

"Both camps are passionate about their fighters, so it has all the ingredients of an amazing event."

You are never going to get a stream of soundbites from Dubois, but he usually gives you one moment. Before facing Anthony Joshua in September 2024, he famously banged the table with his fist.

This time, he kept that same fist to himself - and that made just as many headlines.

He does not appear to relish the media spotlight and that was evident again. He looked reluctant during press duties before the news conference.

Wardley, meanwhile, is entirely at ease with the limelight and happy to trade lines.

When the news conference started, there was more needle than many expected.

But strip all that away and this is a proper heavyweight fight. Credit to Wardley for selecting a high-risk opponent for his first defence. Credit to Dubois for swerving the easy payday after such a destructive loss to Usyk.

In just over 10 weeks, it will not be the managers talking but two heavyweight punchers in the ring, each boasting knockout ratios of 95%.

title: Paul Skenes learns about MLB's new challenge system the hard way
description: Pittsburgh ace Paul Skenes is learning about MLB's new ch the hard way.
fullText:
In his first battle against the automated ball-strike system, Paul Skenes was no match for the robots.

Pitching his first inning of the spring as he ramps up for both the Pittsburgh Pirates and Team USA's World Baseball Classic squad, Skenes faced called strike challenges from Atlanta Braves batters on three occasions.

And the Braves successfully challenged all three calls by homeplate umpire Chris Segal - and added another in the second inning.

Two of the overturns definitely made life more difficult for Skenes. Braves first baseman Matt Olson - one of the game's most disciplined hitters - challenged a 1-1 curveball that Segal called a strike, nicking the outside corner. Olson, a sheepish grin on his face, tapped his head just, you know, to see what happened.

Sure enough, Segal erred - by one-tenth of an inch, ABS ruled - and a 1-2 count became a 2-1 count. Olson went on to draw a two-out walk, illustrating how certain counts - such as 1-1 - are more pivotal and perhaps crucial to challenge.

Thusly emboldened, Jurickson Profar followed by challenging the first pitch - a 98.3 mph fastball seemingly on the outside corner. Segal? Wrong again, this time by a half-inch. And 0-1 became 1-0 and Profar drew a walk.

On challenge No. 3, Skenes finally took matters into his own hands. Jumping ahead 0-2 on Austin Riley, he fired a 99-mph fastball at the top of the zone. Segal punched Riley out - and Riley was tapping his helmet before Skenes could even think to trudge off the mound.

Call overturned - a whole 1.5 inches above the zone.

At that point, the camera turned to Skenes' girlfriend, Livvy Dunne, in the stands at the Braves' CoolToday Park in North Port, Fla. She looked far more relieved when Skenes threw an almost identical pitch - just a smidge lower and in the zone.

And Riley swung through it anyway.

The Braves' pedantry cost Skenes anywhere from three to 13 more pitches, finishing with 31 for the inning. Not necessarily what the Pirates or Skenes wanted.

But he still put up a zero and struck out two - proving robots can only break Skenes down so much.

In his second inning of work, Skenes was his own enemy, issuing walks to Mike Yastrzemski and Mauricio Dub√≥n. Leadoff batter Ronald Acu√±a Jr. then challenged a fastball that ABS ruled was 1.5 inches outside.

Skenes got Acu√±a on a pop-up, seemingly no worse for wear. Even if technology decreed he throw 46 pitches in two innings of work - not exactly the kind of efficiency he'd hoped for.

This article originally appeared on USA TODAY: Paul Skenes victim of MLB's ABS challenge system in first spring start

title: Promising safety prospect named dream draft target for Dallas Cowboys
description: Dallas needs to improve the secondary over the offseason.
fullText:
Promising safety prospect named dream draft target for Dallas Cowboys originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

This offseason should be all about improving the defense for the Dallas Cowboys, both through free agency and via the draft.

When it comes to the draft, there‚Äôs one particular player who has been identified as a fit for the Cowboys.

TCU safety Bud Clark was recently¬†named the dream draft target¬†for the Cowboys this year by Gary Davenport of Bleacher Report.

Clark is coming off of his senior season at TCU where he was named Second-Team All-Big 12 for a second consecutive year. As a senior in 2025, Clark recorded 56 combined tackles, 7 passes defended, 4 interceptions and a sack.

"There's a clear priority for the Cowboys in 2026‚Äîfixing a defense that ranked 30th in yards allowed and was the only team in the league that surrendered over 30 points per game last season," Davenport wrote.

"Safety Bud Clark played a lot of football at TCU and was quite the ballhawk, logging 15 career interceptions. ‚Ä¶ The Cowboys need defenders who can play right away. Getting one early on Day 3 would be a gift."

When asked to describe his game at the Senior Bowl earlier this month, Clark described a ball-hawking, durable defender with solid coverage skills.

‚ÄúI am durable and seem to be in the right places in order to make a play. For the past three years, I played every game. I love to hit, and I am good at it. My coverage skills are really good, too,‚Äù Clark said.

‚ÄúI love receivers who think they are going to end up being open deep. I can rule being a zone defender. I bat down a lot of balls and have had 15 interceptions in the last four years, so I pride myself on being around the ball.‚Äù

Sounds like exactly the type of player that the Cowboys should be looking to draft to strengthen the secondary.

title: ACL fears as Liverpool star set to miss rest of season

fullText:
But Jaros too has now seen his season end due to injury - with the on-loan Ajax goalkeeper requiring surgery on a knee problem.

Jaros had established himself in the Ajax goal following an initially difficult time settling in Amsterdam. But last week he suffered a devastating blow in training - with reports suggesting that the Czech shot-stopper may have damaged an ACL.

"He was in a lot of pain. You still hope it's not too bad, but it didn't look good,‚Äù Ajax stand-in manager Fred Grim told ESPN.

Jaros, 24, moved to the Eredivisie side on loan last summer alongside McConnell to work under former Liverpool assistant coach John Heitinga.

title: Todd Monken: Shedeur Sanders 'elite playmaking' and Browns QB competition notes from NFL Combine
description: A glowing review on Shedeur Sanders and Deshaun Watson. Browns HC Todd Monken reveals state of starting QB.
fullText:
Todd Monken: Shedeur Sanders 'elite playmaking' and Browns QB competition notes from NFL Combine originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

As the NFL world gets ready to over analyze prospect workout drills at the Scouting Combine from Indianapolis this week, Cleveland Browns fans want to hear from their new head coach.

Todd Monken spoke Wednesday at a Combine presser as he embarks on a juggernaut of a journey to rebuild this lethargic offense. Ranked 31st in points-per-game last season, the new skipper noted in his introduction meeting with the media after getting hired, that his goal is to ‚Äúscore points any way possible.‚Äù

A huge part of any offensive success of course revolves around the starting quarterback. Unsurprisingly, many of the questions flying at the podium to Monken revolved around who would be under center.

Here are the most important questions asked, and Monken‚Äôs answers:

More:¬†Browns mock draft round-up: Experts stun with surprise defender & rising OL star

Q- What has your evaluation of Shedeur Sanders been?

Monken- ‚ÄúElite playmaking ability. We saw it on tape, saw it last year, saw it college. Sure there‚Äôs a way to go, but what rookie doesn‚Äôt. I‚Äôm excited about Shedeur and all our quarterbacks‚Äù

Q- How do you intend on distributing reps for quarterbacks in training camp?

Monken- ‚ÄúYou would hope that by training camp the majority of reps go to your starter‚Ä¶but we won‚Äôt know how that plays out until we get there.‚Äù

Q- Will it be an open competition for starting quarterback?

Monken- ‚ÄúSure. I think it‚Äôs an open competition. I don‚Äôt know why it wouldn‚Äôt be. I don‚Äôt think there‚Äôs enough on film one way or the other to feel that we know who our starter is.‚Äù

Monken- ‚ÄúAny time you have a player who at one time played at an elite level, you give them the benefit of the doubt to see if they can get that back. So he‚Äôll get a chance. I don‚Äôt decide who plays, the players decide who plays‚Ä¶I‚Äôm excited to work with him, and excited to work with all our players.‚Äù

Q- Does he think the starting QB could come from outside the organization?

Monken- ‚ÄúThe answer could be externally, I don‚Äôt know, we‚Äôll do our due diligence and have to see.‚Äù

Q- What is the ‚Äúit factor‚Äù when you‚Äôre looking at quarterbacks coming out of the draft?

Monken- ‚ÄúHave to vet people that have been around them for an extended period of time. Having a 20-minute interview (at the Combine) with a player isn‚Äôt nearly enough. How are they in a two-minute drill? Around teammates? Those answers are all important.‚Äù

Q- Have you had a chance to study Ty Simpson, and what your thoughts are on him coming out in the draft?

Monken- I like Ty a lot. Really good football player. His father was a Southern Miss alum, where I was head coach, so got to know him a little bit.

The head coach also was asked about what he‚Äôs looking for in offensive linemen since currently the Browns don‚Äôt have one starter from 2025 signed. ‚ÄúMost of all I‚Äôm looking for someone who‚Äôs physically tough and consistent. Everything else can be coached up if they are willing.‚Äù

One more piece of housekeeping is that assistant defensive line is the last coaching position that Monken has to fill out on his staff.

The new HC presented himself in a poised, confident manner. Now it‚Äôll be up to GM Andrew Berry to give Monken the ingredients to cook up an explosive offense.

title: Marc Marquez said he‚Äôd retire if he was finishing ‚Äòfifth or sixth‚Äô according to Giacomo Agostini
description: Giacomo Agostini says Marc Marquez has no intention of sticking around in MotoGP if he can‚Äôt compete for wins. He‚Äôs now the strong favourite heading into the 2026 season.
fullText:
Giacomo Agostini says Marc Marquez has no intention of sticking around in MotoGP if he can‚Äôt compete for wins.

He‚Äôs now the strong favourite heading into the 2026 season. A title win would draw him level with Agostini atop the premier-class leaderboard, each with eight championships. However, Agostini‚Äôs overall record of 15 Grand Prix titles still seems out of reach.

Even though Marquez is now 33 and one of the older riders on the grid, there‚Äôs little talk about retirement any time soon.

The path forward seems clear enough. A new deal with Ducati is expected soon, and it likely won‚Äôt be his last contract. There‚Äôs also growing belief that he may want to finish his career back where it began, at Honda.

Agostini shared a conversation with Marquez that had stayed with him during an interview with Gazzetta dello Sport.

While many riders on the grid would love to be fighting for top-five finishes right now, Marquez said he would ‚Äòretire‚Äô if that‚Äôs all he could achieve, rather than podiums, wins or titles.

Asked how Marquez ‚Äòmakes the difference‚Äô, Agostini replied: ‚ÄúWith his mentality. He‚Äôs a rider who wants to win at all costs.

‚ÄúOne day, talking to him, he told me that if he had to fight for 5th or 6th place, he‚Äôd retire. For Marquez, the minimum goal is the podium.‚Äù

The Spaniard is targeting his 100th Grand Prix win in Thailand this weekend and could also surpass Valentino Rossi‚Äôs premier-class benchmark of 89 this year (he currently has 73).

Marquez spoke recently about his plans for the future and made it clear that whenever he loses pace with the front of the pack, that‚Äôs when he‚Äôll step away from racing.

Agostini, speaking to Gazzetta dello Sport, recalled a conversation with Marquez that stuck with him. Many riders would be content fighting for top-five finishes, but Marquez said he would retire if that was all he could achieve, rather than aiming for podiums, wins or titles.

When asked what sets Marquez apart, Agostini pointed to his mentality. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs a rider who wants to win at all costs,‚Äù the Italian said. ‚ÄúOne day, talking to him, he told me that if he had to fight for fifth or sixth place, he‚Äôd retire. For Marc Marquez, the minimum goal is the podium.‚Äù

Marquez is currently chasing his 100th Grand Prix win and could also break Rossi‚Äôs record of 89 premier-class victories this season; he sits on 73 at the moment.

Speaking about his future recently, Marquez said he‚Äôll step away when someone else can consistently beat him on track.

title: NHL legend Ron Duguay, partner of Sarah Palin, diagnosed with Stage 4 cancer
description: Duguay‚Äôs family recently launched a GoFundMe fundraiser to cover medical expenses
fullText:
Former New York Rangers player Ron Duguay has been diagnosed with Stage 4 cancer, and his family has set up a GoFundMe page to help cover his medical expenses.

The hockey legend‚Äôs two daughters wrote in the fundraiser‚Äôs description that their father ‚Äî who is currently dating former Alaska governor Sarah Palin ‚Äî would never normally ask for help, ‚Äúbut after many conversations as a family, we decided to create this fundraiser for him because we‚Äôve seen firsthand the weight this battle has placed on him, both physically and financially.‚Äù

Duguay, 68, told Page Six that his cancer started in his colon, resulting in the removal of his appendix and gallbladder.

‚ÄúI find it extremely hard asking for funds for all these costs I‚Äôm going through,‚Äù he told the publication. ‚ÄúNormally, I‚Äôm helping others.‚Äù

The GoFundMe description explained that the money would go toward travel, treatments, holistic care and potential new treatments.

‚ÄúEarlier in his treatment journey, the care he received in Florida nearly cost him his life. That led us to bring him to Orange County, where my sister and I live, so he could receive treatment here,‚Äù the page reads, as it was noted that Duguay flies from Florida to Orange County, California, every two weeks for treatment.

‚ÄúThe cost of constant travel, along with medical care, holistic therapies, supplements, and alternative healing approaches he has committed to, has become extremely overwhelming financially.‚Äù

The post continued: ‚ÄúRecently, his cancer numbers have started to rise again, and while he continues his current treatments, we are now exploring additional treatment options outside of the United States in hopes of giving him the best possible chance. These treatments are very expensive and add another layer of financial strain during an already difficult time.‚Äù

As of Wednesday afternoon, the fundraiser has earned over $54,000.

Duguay shares his two adult daughters, Shay Thomas and Amber Stavros, with his first wife, Robin Bobo. He also has a son, Noah, 32, with his second wife, Kim Alexis.

On Tuesday, Thomas posted a montage of clips to Instagram of her father throughout the treatment process, including some clips with his girlfriend, Palin, 62.

The politician discussed her boyfriend‚Äôs illness previously during an April 2025 defamation retrial against The New York Times over a 2017 editorial in New York City. At the time, the press asked her where Duguay was as she responded, ‚ÄúOh, he‚Äôs battling a health issue right now, but otherwise very well.‚Äù

While Duguay initially played for the Rangers from 1977 to 1983, throughout his 12-season career, he also played for the Red Wings, Kings and Penguins, earning a total of 274 goals and 346 assists. Following his hockey career, he called Ranger games on MSG Network for 12 years before the network dismissed him in 2018.

title: Is Scottie Scheffler playing this week? World's No. 1 golfer upcoming schedule goes past Cognizant Classic
description: Scottie is the guy everyone wants to watch.
fullText:
Is Scottie Scheffler playing this week? World's No. 1 golfer upcoming schedule goes past Cognizant Classic originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Scottie Scheffler is the guy everyone wants to watch.

The world's No. 1 golfer has risen into a guy everyone knows by just his first name, and he's the most consistently impressive player on the PGA Tour.

He's also made an odd habit the last couple weeks, where he has a rough first round and spends the next three rounds working himself back toward the top of the leaderboard.

It's probably not something he wants to keep doing, but he'll get to reset this week.

The PGA Tour heads to the Cognizant Classic. Scheffler does not.

No, Scheffler isn't playing this week at the Cognizant Classic.

That opens up the tournament to a potentially different batch of favorites. When Scheffler plays, he's always a heavy betting favorite to win.

Scheffler played each of the past three weeks, placing third at the WM Phoenix Open, fourth at the Pebble Beach Pro-Am and 12th at the Genesis Invitational.

Scheffler is slated to play two tournaments in March.

The first is the Arnold Palmer Invitational, which begins on March 5.

The other is the following week, with The Players Championship starting on March 12.

The Masters is April 9, and it wouldn't be surprising if Scheffler added in one more tournament before that one.

title: TypeDB Studio's AI agent for schema exploration and query generation
description: You‚Äôre probably familiar with vibe coding ‚Äî the practice of describing what you want in plain English and letting an AI write the code. In this article we show ...
fullText:
You‚Äôre probably familiar with vibe coding ‚Äî the practice of describing what you want in plain English and letting an AI write the code. In this article we show how the concept translates to databases using the Agent Mode feature of TypeDB Studio.

Vibe querying is exactly what it sounds like. Instead of writing this:

Get all people with their names and emails.

The AI reads your database schema, understands the structure of your data, and generates TypeQL in the chat. You click Run, and the results appear inline in your chat window.

Why use Agent Mode in TypeDB Studio? Agent mode can be used for asking questions about your database, building your schema and querying your data ‚Äì all the essential day-to-day DB operations. It‚Äôs particularly useful for:

Overall it‚Äôs just a more hassle-free way to build with TypeDB.

The easiest way to try this is to boot up a free TypeDB Cloud cluster with the social-network sample dataset preloaded; alternatively you can also initialise it in TypeDB CE (Cloud page / CE setup guide)

Suppose this is your first time browsing the social network dataset. You probably want to get the lay of the land. Ask the AI agent ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs in my schema?‚Äù and it will come up with a detailed description you can read.

Behind the scenes, TypeDB Studio has attached the schema as context to the LLM that powers agent mode, which has attempted to decipher the schema for the user (you).

I am a visual learner ‚Äì so had to give this one a try.

Not exactly Picasso ‚Äì but successful nonetheless; agent mode can indeed render your schema as ASCII art.

Before agent mode: poke around in schema, scratch head, read docs, do actual hard work.

After agent mode: ‚ÄúHey benevolent AI bot, could you just dream up some interesting queries for me?‚Äù

Not bad ‚Äì its top three suggestions are simple enough:

Let‚Äôs go ahead and run the second of these queries ‚Äì showing a ‚Äòcontact card‚Äô per person:

Cool. We have our contact cards! That being said, there‚Äôs a lot of nulls. Is the query definitely correct?

Let‚Äôs hop back to the log output view for now. Remember that magic wand icon in the top right? Click that, and you‚Äôll automagically send a new message containing the full log. The agent attempts to interpret these results. In the case of a successful query, it‚Äôll typically suggest follow-up queries you could run. In the case of an error, it‚Äôll try to diagnose the error and come up with a fixed query.

In this case when we send back the query, it suggests several follow-up queries, one of which is indeed a sanity check on whether any phone numbers exist at all in our dataset. It turns out they do not, so the phone property is largely for illustrative purposes.

LLMs are genuinely impressive these days ‚Äì and TypeDB‚Äôs AI agent is backed by GPT-5.2, a very powerful model. It still gets things wrong sometimes, though. Consider the following generated query:

At first the AI agent generates a query based on the idea of using subqueries inside a fetch, but unfortunately this returns a syntax error. We click the ‚Äúmagic wand‚Äù icon in the top right of the log, and this happens ‚Ä¶

The agent tries a different approach and writes a correct query.

The ‚ÄúFix with AI‚Äù button isn‚Äôt limited to Agent Mode. If you‚Äôre using the Query page to write TypeQL yourself, and you get an error ‚Äì or an unexpectedly empty result set ‚Äì you can hit ‚ÄúFix with AI‚Äù (the magic wand button) and it‚Äôll send the query log to a new Agent Mode conversation and have the agent describe what it thinks might be wrong.

LLMs are perfectly capable of generating database queries in SQL, Cypher, and so on.

From our research so far we‚Äôve found that TypeDB Studio is a trailblazer in its early release of a fully-integrated AI assistant. Unlike other data platforms, the Studio agent is always aware of your data context (your schema) ‚Äì and it allows you to actually run queries without leaving the assistant chat ‚Äì a streamlined and better user experience.

Agents that deal with complexity fail in predictable ways when they lack semantic grounding. They create invalid states. They make assumptions about the definitions and structures of concepts when there isn‚Äôt a clear, semantically rich schema setting those things out.

TypeDB exhibits the following properties that are all of great value to an AI agent:

You can learn more about the power of semantic richness in: Why agents need ontologies

Agent mode provides a totally new way of interacting with TypeDB. Its self-healing capabilities allow it to easily fix mistakes providing for an overall smooth experience. You don‚Äôt need prior knowledge of TypeQL ‚Äì just ask questions in natural language and get answers.

Here are some quick links to get up and running with TypeDB Studio and with vibe querying and to learn more:

title: Russia sends migrants into Europe through secret tunnels
description: Mystery specialists from Middle East recruited to construct underground routes, The Telegraph can reveal
fullText:
Russia is sending migrants through underground tunnels from Belarus into Europe as part of its hybrid war on the West.

Belarus, a Russian puppet state led by dictator Alexander Lukashenko, has used specialists from the Middle East with ‚Äúa high level of expertise‚Äù to design the tunnels, Polish officials have told The Telegraph.

The Great Escape-style tactic marks a new escalation in the Kremlin‚Äôs hybrid war on Europe, in which Minsk has tried to send tens of thousands of migrants across Poland‚Äôs eastern frontier.

Polish officials said the specialists who designed and dug the tunnels had a ‚Äúhigh level of expertise‚Äù.

And while experts say it is hard to be sure which groups were involved, they have suggested Kurdish fighters, Islamic State and Iranian-backed proxies as potential culprits.

Poland has also suggested that Belarus resorted to hiring the mysterious Middle Eastern specialists because it was seeking new and more inventive methods of sneaking migrants across the border.

‚ÄúOfficers of the Podlaskie Border Guard Unit have uncovered a total of four tunnels under the border with Belarus, all in 2025,‚Äù Lt Col Katarzyna Zdanowicz, from the Polish border force, told The Telegraph.

‚ÄúPhysical and electronic security measures at the border, such as thermal imaging cameras and detection systems, allow us to immediately respond to any attempted violations of the state border, even underground ones,‚Äù he added.

Polish authorities discovered one of the largest tunnels, near the village of Narewka in eastern Poland, in mid-December.

It was used by a total of 180 migrants, mainly from Afghanistan and Pakistan, with the majority of them arrested after they emerged on the other side.

According to Poland, the tunnel was 1.5m high with the entrance on the Belarusian side hidden in a forest. The tunnel ran for around 50 metres on the Belarusian side of the border and for 10 metres on the Polish side.

Polish police also released images of some of the 130 migrants who were arrested after emerging from the tunnels.

Video footage of the tunnel itself shows a narrow crawlspace-like structure, with concrete struts fixed to the sides to prevent it from collapsing.

Military experts say the only Middle Eastern groups known to be capable of such tunnels are Hamas in the Gaza Strip, Hezbollah in Lebanon, certain factions in Kurdistan, and possibly Islamic State.

Dr Lynette Nusbacher, an American military historian and strategist, said it was ‚Äúplausible‚Äù that Iranian-backed groups such as Hezbollah might be the culprits.

‚ÄúOne of the things we immediately saw after the 2006 Lebanon war was parades of cement mixers queuing up in southern Lebanon...we were seeing loads and loads of Iranian tunnel construction,‚Äù she said.

‚ÄúWe also have ample evidence of Hamas doing the same thing in Gaza. So if you want that deep tunnelling expertise, then the answer to your question is going to be with Middle Easterners.‚Äù

Major Rob Campbell, a fortifications expert and former British Army sapper, also said Hamas was a possible culprit after reviewing footage of the tunnels in Poland.

‚ÄúIf I had to speculate, experts from the Middle East would be Hamas or Palestinian Islamic Jihad,‚Äù he said, referring to another Palestinian faction in the Gaza Strip.

Sarit Zehavi, a former Israeli intelligence colonel, said Iranian-backed proxies were just one of several possible explanations.

‚ÄúDoes Hezbollah or any Iranian proxies have this capability? Yes. Are they the only ones? No. Probably others also have the knowledge, from Kurdish militias in Syria to Isis,‚Äù she said.

Marcin Kierwi≈Ñski, a Polish official, has previously said that some of the tunnellers came from Kurdistan, but added that Poland ultimately holds the Belarusian regime responsible.

Last month, Al-Jazeera, the Qatari broadcaster, reported the discovery of a vast network of tunnels below the Syrian city of Raqqa, which had been dug by the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF).

Under Lukashenko, who has ruled for more than 30 years, Belarus has played an active role in Putin‚Äôs attempts to destabilise the West via waves of migration.

Even prior to the 2022 invasion of Ukraine, Belarus was used as a staging area to send thousands of migrants across the Polish border, prompting Warsaw to build a 200km fence with 300 cameras.

Since the full-scale Ukraine invasion, Russia has also launched dozens of drone incursions and firebomb attacks on European airports, as well as a string of sabotage attacks on factories and railways supplying aid to Ukraine.

The ultimate goal is to punish the West over its military support for Ukraine and try to turn the public against Volodymyr Zelensky‚Äôs government in Kyiv.

As a wider part of that strategy, Belarus has been sending waves of balloons carrying contraband into neighbouring Nato countries to create air traffic chaos and probe for air defence weaknesses.

The tactic initially targeted Lithuania, but Polish officials say Belarusian balloons ‚Äì usually loaded with bootleg cigarettes ‚Äì are increasingly being sent in their direction.

When it comes to dealing with the tunnels, Poland says it is more than capable of tracking down the entrances and blowing them up.

But there are concerns that, each time Warsaw closes off one access point to Europe for migrants, another one springs up elsewhere.

One minister has even suggested that the appearance of Middle Eastern-designed tunnels under Poland is a sign that their border force is too good at its job.

‚ÄúDigging these tunnels means that our effectiveness in stopping migration is so high that it was decided to bring in specialists from the Middle East to dig them,‚Äù said Czes≈Çaw Mroczek, the deputy interior minister, in a recent interview on Polish radio.

title: US judge dismisses xAI trade-secrets lawsuit against rival OpenAI for now
description: A federal judge in California¬†on Tuesday dismissed a lawsuit from Elon Musk's artificial intelligence startup xAI that accused rival Sam Altman's OpenAI ‚Äåof stealing its trade secrets.  U.S. District Judge Rita Lin in San Francisco ‚Äåsaid that xAI could refile its case, but for now has failed to allege that OpenAI committed any ‚Äãmisconduct.  The lawsuit, filed in September, claimed that former xAI employees took source code related to its Grok chatbot and other confidential information with them when they left for new jobs at OpenAI.
fullText:
Feb 24 (Reuters) - A federal judge in California on Tuesday dismissed a lawsuit from Elon Musk's artificial intelligence startup xAI that accused rival Sam Altman's OpenAI ‚Äåof stealing its trade secrets.

U.S. District Judge Rita Lin in San Francisco ‚Äåsaid that xAI could refile its case, but for now has failed to allege that OpenAI committed any ‚Äãmisconduct.

What damages is Musk seeking in related litigation?

What broader legal battle exists between Musk and OpenAI?

Why did the judge dismiss xAI's lawsuit against OpenAI?

What trade secrets did xAI claim were stolen?

The lawsuit, filed in September, claimed that former xAI employees took source code related to its Grok chatbot and other confidential information with them when they left for new jobs at OpenAI.

"Notably absent are allegations about the conduct of OpenAI itself," Lin said. "xAI does not allege ‚Äåany facts indicating that OpenAI ‚Å†induced xAI‚Äôs former employees to steal xAI‚Äôs trade secrets or that these former xAI employees used any stolen trade secrets once employed ‚Å†by OpenAI."

Lin had signaled in a January opinion that she would likely rule for OpenAI. She gave xAI until March 17 to file an amended complaint.

xAI has separately sued a former engineer, ‚ÄãXuechen Li, ‚Äãfor allegedly taking trade secrets to the ChatGPT ‚Äãmaker. Li was blocked in that ‚Äåcase from sharing xAI's technology with OpenAI, though OpenAI has said that Li never worked for the company and that it never acquired or used any of xAI's secrets.

Spokespeople and attorneys for xAI did not immediately respond to a request for comment on the Tuesday decision.

"We welcome the court's decision," OpenAI said in a statement. "This baseless lawsuit was ‚Äånever anything more than yet another front in ‚ÄãMr. Musk's ongoing campaign of harassment."

The lawsuit is part ‚Äãof a broader legal battle between ‚ÄãMusk and Microsoft-backed OpenAI, which he co-founded and is also suing ‚Äåover its conversion to a for-profit company.

Musk, ‚Äãthe world's richest ‚Äçperson, is ‚Äãseeking as much as $134.5 billion in damages from OpenAI and Microsoft in that case. Jury selection is scheduled for April 27.

OpenAI said in a court filing that ‚Äãthe trade-secrets case was part ‚Äåof a "campaign to harass a competitor with unfounded legal claims" because Grok ‚Äãcould not keep up with ChatGPT.
