title: Matos: Swansea's long-term aim is Premier League
description: Swansea head coach Vitor Matos admits a return to the Premier League is an "aim for the future".  The Swans continued their unbeaten run with a late equaliser against Preston North End on Tuesday night in front of superstar rapper Snoop Dogg.  The hip-hop legend is one of the club's co-owners and has boosted the profile of Swansea, who have been in the Championship since relegation from the Premier League in 2018.
fullText:
Swansea head coach Vitor Matos admits a return to the Premier League is an "aim for the future".

The Swans continued their unbeaten run with a late equaliser against Preston North End on Tuesday night in front of superstar rapper Snoop Dogg.

The hip-hop legend is one of the club's co-owners and has boosted the profile of Swansea, who have been in the Championship since relegation from the Premier League in 2018.

"We need to build. The foundations need to be built. We need to find the spirit again," said Matos.

"It's a completely different world nowadays than before. To reinvent ourselves, that's what we are trying. Starting on the pitch, starting with the players, starting with the culture and moving on."

Matos took charge in November following the dismissal of Alan Sheehan, who had overseen just four wins in the club's opening 15 league matches.

Swansea have now taken 10 points from their last five fixtures, narrowing the gap to the Championship play-off places to eight points, and have enjoyed the buzz of a visit from Snoop.

"It's exciting times for the club. It's good to have someone like him involved, someone who has that kind of profile, who brings a lot of visibility as well," said Matos.

"That is just a good feeling. We are, as a club, trying to create something different and something special."

title: Sweden Boss Potter Has ‚ÄúFingers Crossed‚Äù for Alexander Isak Return
description: Graham Potter is hoping Alexander Isak will be able to play against Ukraine on March 26th.
fullText:
Back in the autumn, following Liverpool‚Äôs big money signing of Alexander Isak but with the player not fully match fit following an acrimonious departure from Newcastle United that saw him miss pre-season as he pushed for the move, Sweden national team manager Jon Dahl Tomasson went out of his way to protect the player.

With Sweden then failing to secure a World Cup berth via UEFA qualification, Jon Dahl Tomasson lost his job. His replacement, Graham Potter, still has the chance to qualify them to next summer‚Äôs expanded 48-team World Cup via a playoff thanks to the country‚Äôs success in the Nations League. And there are questions as to whether he‚Äôll be as careful with Isak‚Äôs health as Tomasson.

‚ÄúRight now we‚Äôre just keeping our fingers crossed,‚Äù Potter said when asked by Swedish journalists about the possibility of a trio of key injured players including Liverpool striker Isak back in time face Ukraine in late March. ‚ÄúHopefully we can get some of those guys back‚Äîbut if not, we have to find a solution with the guys that are available.‚Äù

In addition to Isak, Potter and Sweden are without ¬†Dejan Kulusevski and Lucas Bergvall. Kulusevski is by all accounts ruled out through the qualification playoff period, but the end of March falls close to when Isak and Bergvall might be getting their first on-pitch minutes‚Äîthough it‚Äôs hard to imagine either being match fit.

Sweden will play Ukraine on March 26th in a semi-final, with the winner then taking on the winner of Poland vs. Albania in the March 31 qualification final to secure one of those four nations a place at the 2026 World Cup in a group with Netherlands, Japan, and Tunisia.

title: Prep talk: Parents are multitasking at high school baseball games
description: Setting up cameras, monitoring streaming devices and keeping score are new tasks for parents while watching their children play.
fullText:
It's nerve-racking enough for parents watching their son or daughter pitch. Imagine what Omar Sahagan goes through when his son, Connor, is on the mound for Oaks Christian High's baseball team and he's trying to multitask with responsibilities of carrying around a laptop so he can score the game for GameChanger while also monitoring the live steam he set up with a camera.

"It's beyond nerve-racking," he said.

Technology is changing high school baseball for teams and parents. pic.twitter.com/FhPTA8bEdv

‚Äî eric sondheimer (@latsondheimer) February 24, 2026

In case no one has noticed, take a look at all the devices hanging from nets or fences at baseball fields. They are cameras from parents, players and teams trying to capture video and produce metrics, whether for hitting or pitching as well as provide highlights. Technology continues to change the way highlights and information can be shared on cellphones or computers.

Sahagan seems to enjoy his contributions to the Oaks Christian program, but watching his son remains his priority, which can be challenging when he's pitching, producing moments of anxiety.

But it's a lesson for others ‚Äî multitasking is now part of sports life in the 21st century and is only going to keep expanding with changes in technology.

This is a daily look at the positive happenings in high school sports. To submit any news, please email eric.sondheimer@latimes.com.

A. Times SoCal high school sports newsletter to get scores, stories and a behind-the-scenes look at what makes prep sports so popular.

This story originally appeared in Los Angeles Times.

title: Chris Ballard with injury update on Colts' DT DeForest Buckner
description: At the 2026 NFL combine, Chris Ballard provided an update on Indianapolis Colts' DT DeForest Buckner.
fullText:
When meeting with reporters at the 2026 NFL combine, general manager Chris Ballard provided an update on Indianapolis Colts' defensive tackle DeForest Buckner, who underwent a procedure on a neck injury.

Buckner originally landed on injured reserve in Week 9 with a neck injury he sustained against Pittsburgh. After missing several weeks, Buckner returned for the Colts' Monday Night game against San Francisco in Week 16, but would reaggravate the injury.

He was then placed on injured reserve and had successful surgery before the Colts' 2025 season was over.

"He's good," Ballard said of Buckner. "I think it was some relief for Buck when he got it done. He's had injuries in his career but really it was the first time that he had one that was pretty serious. And then getting the surgery done, the relief that I think he felt -- one, knowing I feel better. Instantly felt better. And two, I can play football again."

Compared to the defensive tackle position group league-wide, Buckner ranks 24th in pass rush win rate and 14th in PFF's run stop rate metric.

Even with missing most of the second half of the season, Buckner is still second on the Colts' defense in pressures.

The 2026 season is the final year of Buckner's current deal. Ballard expects that Buckner will be good to go for training camp, if not sooner.

"I'm not going to put a timeframe on it," Ballard said. "We're expecting him back for training camp. The way he works and who he is, it wouldn't surprise me if it's sooner. But he'll be back and he'll be ready to go and I think he'll have a good year."

This article originally appeared on Colts Wire: 2026 NFL combine: What Colts' Chris Ballard said about DeForest Buckner

title: 2028 Georgia offensive tackle schedules Tennessee football visit
description: A 2028 four-star offensive tackle from Georgia schedules a visit to Tennessee.
fullText:
Tennessee is recruiting toward its 2028 football signing class.

Four-star offensive tackle Kweli Fielder will visit Tennessee on March 21, according to Tom Loy of 247Sports. He will also visit Florida, Auburn, Virginia Tech, Ohio State, Georgia and South Carolina.

The 6-foot-4, 310-pound prospect is from Carrollton High School in Carrollton, Georgia. 247Sports ranks him as the No. 3 offensive tackle in the class and the No. 2 player in Georgia.

Tennessee offered Fielder a scholarship on Jan. 23, 2025. The 2028 prospect's visit on March 21 will be his first to Tennessee.

Mississippi State was the first school to offer Fielder a scholarship on May 15, 2024. Other schools to offer him scholarships include Syracuse, Florida State, Duke, Ole Miss, Colorado, Indiana, Kentucky, Miami, Pittsburgh, Nebraska, Florida Atlantic, Alabama, LSU, Texas A&M, USF and Texas.

Tennessee does not have a commitment in its 2028 football recruiting class. The Vols have four commitments in their 2027 football recruiting class: linebacker JP Peace, offensive tackle Princeton Uwaifo, defensive lineman Kadin Fife and quarterback Derrick Baker.

title: Canadiens' Patrik Laine $8.7 million trade obstacle is less intimidating than it appears
description: Montreal could be looking to make a move.
fullText:
Canadiens' Patrik Laine $8.7 million trade obstacle is less intimidating than it appears originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Patrik Laine has missed most of the season with an injury. That would be the first obstacle to trading him before the NHL's March 6 trade deadline.

The Montreal Canadiens got good news on that front, though.

"He hasn‚Äôt played a game since October after having surgery on a core muscle, but Laine returned to practice with Montreal over the Olympic break, and the potential for a trade involving the scoring winger is growing," wrote Sportsnet's Nick Kypreos in a new trade article on Tuesday.

The other thing that looms large about Laine is his $8.7 million cap hit. That's not as intimidating as it appears, though.

"His $8.7 million cap hit might be high at first glance, but Laine is in the final year of that deal, so it‚Äôs a low-risk pickup for a team," Kypreos writes. "Montreal also hasn't used any of its salary retention slots, so it would entertain the idea of lowering Laine's cap hit for a trade partner."

MORE:¬†Maple Leafs have a very specific draft pick reason to tank

That number might still eliminate some teams from trade talks, but there are some contenders who could make it work with Montreal.

The biggest concern might really be Laine's health. It'd probably increase confidence for an acquiring team if Laine got back on the ice in the next week with the Canadiens just to confirm everything looks OK.

If he's healthy, he's worth looking into.

"If you‚Äôre a team that needs to find some scoring and wants to take a chance on Laine for a couple of months, he‚Äôs certainly attainable for little cost," Kypreos writes.

title: Rich Beem highlights what fans may not notice about Scottie Scheffler‚Äôs behaviour on the course
description: Rich Beem has given some insight into what viewers at home might not pick up on about how Scottie Scheffler acts on the course, as the world number one looks to get back on track after an odd start to the year. Scottie Scheffler may have already picked up a win this season, but his slow starts in recent events have caught more attention than his victory at The American Express.
fullText:
Rich Beem has given some insight into what viewers at home might not pick up on about how Scottie Scheffler acts on the course, as the world number one looks to get back on track after an odd start to the year.

Scottie Scheffler may have already picked up a win this season, but his slow starts in recent events have caught more attention than his victory at The American Express.

He‚Äôs failed to shoot under par in the opening rounds of his last three tournaments: the WM Phoenix Open, the AT&T Pebble Beach Pro-Am, and now the Genesis Invitational.

On Thursday at Riviera, he was five over through 10 holes when play was suspended, marking the worst opening round of his PGA Tour career.

What‚Äôs made things stranger is how he has responded each time. Despite the slow starts, Scheffler hasn‚Äôt finished lower than 12th this year and was just one shot away from making the playoff at TPC Scottsdale.

Speaking on the Sky Sports Golf Podcast, Rich Beem said he is confused by what is happening with Scheffler right now. He also pointed out that the 29-year-old might not be as calm as people think.

‚ÄúI can‚Äôt explain it. Somebody has asked me what‚Äôs going on with Scottie Scheffler? Well, he‚Äôs human, first of all, we know that. It doesn‚Äôt make sense, especially from the standpoint of Phoenix, he still went out and made five or six birdies in the opening round and still shot over par,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúI can understand maybe Riviera, opening day, very tough. I can even understand maybe a little bit where you get off to a bland start at Pebble Beach. It‚Äôs not going to get any easier going forward. I‚Äôm assuming his next start is going to be Bay Hill where he‚Äôs won. Then he‚Äôs going to go to The Players Championship, one of the hardest golf courses on tour.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a trend that could continue just because of the venues, not that I fully expect it to, but it‚Äôs just not happening for him. And we all know that he gets a little hot under the collar at times. Maybe some people don‚Äôt quite see it as much as we do in the media when we follow him every day.‚Äù

There‚Äôs an argument that Scheffler handles pressure better than anyone else in the field. Few players look as relaxed when they‚Äôre out in front.

But heading into 2026, it‚Äôs been a while since we‚Äôve seen him truly at his best. Even when results dipped early last season, he was coming off a hand injury ‚Äì and most understood the slow return.

He‚Äôs had his moments of frustration too. The one that stands out is his reaction during the BMW Championship in 2024, which drew plenty of criticism at the time.

Even so, you have to give Scheffler credit for how he‚Äôs managed to fight back recently. In each of his last three starts, he turned things around when it could have gone wrong.

If he hadn‚Äôt found a way to channel that frustration, there‚Äôs every chance he‚Äôd have missed two cuts already this season ‚Äì and not by narrow margins either.

title: Ranji Trophy final explodes: J&K captain Paras Dogra headbutts Karnataka fielder
description: Jammu and Kashmir captain Paras Dogra headbutted a Karnataka substitute fielder during the Ranji Trophy final, sparking heated exchanges. Despite the incident and subsequent confrontations, Jammu and Kashmir continued to dominate, building on a strong first innings performance.
fullText:
NEW DELHI: The Ranji Trophy final witnessed extraordinary scenes on Day 2 as Jammu and Kashmir captain Paras Dogra lost his temper and headbutted a Karnataka substitute fielder, triggering heated exchanges and forcing umpires to step in at the Hubli Cricket Ground on Wednesday.

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. 

The flashpoint came in the 101st over of Jammu and Kashmir‚Äôs first innings when Dogra was batting alongside Kanhaiya Wadhawan during a crucial partnership. After edging a delivery from Prasidh Krishna for a boundary, Dogra exchanged words with substitute fielder KV Aneesh, who was stationed at forward short leg.

As the verbal duel escalated, Dogra suddenly charged at Aneesh and headbutted him with his helmet. The shocking act stunned players and officials alike, with Karnataka captain Mayank Agarwal quickly intervening to defuse the situation while umpires rushed in to restore order.

‚Äî NihariVsKorma (@NihariVsKorma)

Dogra apologised at the end of the over, but Aneesh refused to accept it, remaining visibly upset. The tension did not end there, as Agarwal and KL Rahul joined in, directing sharp verbal responses towards the Jammu and Kashmir skipper.

Matters threatened to spiral further when Karnataka pacer Vijaykumar Vyshak and Wadhawan clashed moments later following accidental contact during a run. The pair came face to face before umpires and teammates stepped in to separate them, preventing another confrontation.

Despite the dramatic scenes, Jammu and Kashmir continued to dominate the contest. The visitors strengthened their position by moving past 350-mark, building on the strong foundation laid on Day 1.

Earlier, Shubham Pundir‚Äôs magnificent 121 had put Jammu and Kashmir in control, while valuable contributions from Yawer Hassan (88) and Abdul Samad (61) kept Karnataka on the back foot.

title: Women‚Äôs college basketball Bubble Watch: Will Princeton make the Ivy a two-bid league?
description: Editor‚Äôs note: This article is part of the Bracket Central series, an inside look at the run-up to the men‚Äôs & women‚Äôs NCAA Tournaments, along with analysis and picks during the tournaments. Bubble teams are officially in desperation mode. With only one week left in the regular season and conference tournaments looming, few chances remain for resume-boosting wins. But all hope is not lost ‚Äî Clemson and Virginia proved that over the weekend. Here‚Äôs who‚Äôs in, who‚Äôs out and who needs to channel the
fullText:
Editor‚Äôs note: This article is part of the¬†Bracket Central¬†series, an inside look at the run-up to the men‚Äôs & women‚Äôs NCAA Tournaments, along with analysis and picks during the tournaments.

Bubble teams are officially in desperation mode. With only one week left in the regular season and conference tournaments looming, few chances remain for resume-boosting wins. But all hope is not lost ‚Äî Clemson and Virginia proved that over the weekend.

Here‚Äôs who‚Äôs in, who‚Äôs out and who needs to channel the magic of March before Selection Sunday arrives:

It was a massive weekend in the ACC. After winning 17 games in a row, including 15 in conference play, Duke finally suffered a defeat. So did Louisville, the conference‚Äôs second-place team behind the Blue Devils. In the grand scheme of things, the losses won‚Äôt affect Duke and Louisville when it comes to seeding, but the teams on the other side of those upsets get huge boosts.

Clemson defeated Duke 53-51 off a 3-pointer from junior Hannah Kohn, and Virginia snuck past Louisville on a 3 from senior Romi Levy with 13 seconds left to play.

Similar endings for teams with similar resumes make for similar results. In other words, both Clemson and Virginia are on the right side of the bubble. Not only are their victories categorized as Quad 1 wins, but they also come at the perfect time. With just one week left in the regular season, wins mean more. The committee wants to see teams in the tournament that are having success right now. When Selection Sunday comes around, Clemson and Virginia will be top of mind.

Mississippi State is 11th in the SEC with an 18-10 record. At first glance, the Bulldogs don‚Äôt seem like a March Madness squad. But luckily for them, the committee doesn‚Äôt make decisions based on a glance.

Playing in the SEC has provided Mississippi State with a major resume boost in multiple ways. First, it helps with both NET ranking and strength of schedule. It also provides opportunities for quality wins. Mississippi State has two Quad 1 wins and one Quad 2 win, beating Kentucky, Tennessee and Georgia. The Bulldogs have a couple of bad conference losses to Florida and Missouri, but the big wins more than make up for those stumbles.

Last week we talked about Nebraska‚Äôs bizarre resume, which was missing one major thing: a Quad 1 win. Now, in addition to a No. 28 ranking in the NET and the 12th-best strength of schedule, Nebraska finally has a signature win. The Huskers went on the road Sunday and defeated Washington 66-65, which also snapped a six-game losing streak. As it stands, Nebraska will sneak into the field as one of the last four teams. A win or two in the Big Ten tournament would ensure a bid, but a loss to Rutgers in its last regular-season game would almost certainly spoil Nebraska‚Äôs chances.

The closer we get to tournament time, the more likely the Ivy League looks like it will be the only two-bid mid-major conference. After losing to Columbia twice, Princeton is in second place in the Ivy, but these two squads likely will meet in the conference tournament championship. That should be enough for both to earn bids given their overall strong resumes.

As for other mid-majors in the hunt, Richmond‚Äôs back-to-back losses to George Mason and George Washington (the latter a Quad 4 loss) slim the chance of earning an at-large bid. The same goes for South Dakota State, which needs to avenge earlier losses to North Dakota State and South Dakota in its final two games in order to make a March Madness push.

title: Alan Brazil says Tottenham Hotspur have not spoken with Mauricio Pochettino over becoming next manager
description: Tottenham Hotspur have yet to speak with Mauricio Pochettino over appointing him as their next permanent manager, according to talkSPORT presenter Alan Brazil. The Tottenham Hotspur Stadium club repor...
fullText:
Tottenham Hotspur have yet to speak with Mauricio Pochettino over appointing him as their next permanent manager, according to talkSPORT presenter Alan Brazil. The Tottenham Hotspur Stadium club reportedly were open to appointing a temporary boss until someone like Pochettino is available in the summer. Spurs have since given Igor Tudor the job until the end of the season, but the North London club are not in contact with the Argentine, claims Brazil.

Pochettino will be available to return to club football after the World Cup in June, but it appears Tottenham want to wait until the end of the season before making any decision. They are not guaranteed safety right now and will need to hold on to their Premier League status to bring their former manager back. The Lilywhites are 16th in the league table ahead of the remaining 11 games of the campaign, and failure to quickly turn their fortunes on the pitch around could be hugely disastrous.

Tudor wants the permanent job but he needs to keep Spurs up to boost his chances.

Pochettino remains a target for Tottenham despite not holding talks with him yet, but there are no guarantees he has what it takes to turn them into domestic heavyweights again given various underlying problems at the club.

Spurs could do with new owners going forward if they really want to start competing with the bigwigs in the Premier League again.

title: Messi keeping his distance from Barcelona presidential elections; hasn‚Äôt authorised usage of his name, posters
description: As Barcelona‚Äôs presidential campaign gathers pace, Lionel Messi‚Äôs name continues to surface, despite the player having no desire to be part of the political noise surrounding the club.In fact, a r...
fullText:
As Barcelona‚Äôs presidential campaign gathers pace, Lionel Messi‚Äôs name continues to surface, despite the player having no desire to be part of the political noise surrounding the club.

In fact, a recent report from MARCA reveals that banners and indirect references to the Argentine legend are being used by candidates without his knowledge or consent.

Furthermore, according to sources close to Messi, he has not held conversations with any of the presidential hopefuls and does not intend to do so while the electoral process is ongoing.

The irony is striking, as Messi has become one of the most talked-about figures in the campaign, yet he has actively chosen to remain on the sidelines.

From the very beginning, he did not want to influence or be associated with any candidacy.

One of the clearest examples came from Marc Ciria, who displayed a banner in Barcelona carrying the phrase ‚ÄúLooking forward to seeing you again.‚Äù

Although the message avoided directly naming Messi or showing a clear image of him, the meaning was obvious to supporters.

The gesture created buzz, but it reportedly took Messi‚Äôs camp by surprise.

There was also movement from Victor Font. It is said that attempts were made to connect with individuals close to the Argentine.

Those efforts, however, did not lead to direct contact. Font has since explained that any past communication occurred years ago and not with Messi personally.

Meanwhile, the last club president, Joan Laporta, has publicly discussed his relationship with the former captain.

Laporta has spoken about Messi‚Äôs departure and the possibility of a testimonial, stating that the final decision rests with the player. For now, though, only Laporta‚Äôs perspective has been aired publicly.

As such, Messi‚Äôs entourage continues to repeat the same message that there will be no involvement, either openly or quietly.

Even if certain developments in the campaign have not pleased him, he will not intervene.

title: Chloe Kim, Suni Lee have epic Olympic champ link up in NYC
description: The 2026 Winter Olympics are in the books, so athletes are returning to their everyday lives after an incredible two weeks of content. With their competitions in the books, the stars of the Milan Cortina Games are back on social‚Ä¶
fullText:
The 2026 Winter Olympics are in the books, so athletes are returning to their everyday lives after an incredible two weeks of content. With their competitions in the books, the stars of the Milan Cortina Games are back on social media and sharing their escapades.

For snowboarding sensation Chloe Kim, who won silver in the halfpipe competition and her third Olympic medal overall, that meant serving up an incredible moment for her fans.

The 25-year-old Kim was enjoying some time in snowy New York, making the media rounds, when she linked up with another Olympic champion.

MORE: Chloe Kim ‚Äòobsessed‚Äô with $100k gift from NFL star Myles Garrett after Olympics

Kim and American gymnast Suni Lee came together for a photo that fans could not get enough of.

Suni Lee and Chloe Kim linked up in New York

Two Olympic icons. NINE combined Olympic medals

‚Äî Yahoo Sports (@YahooSports) February 25, 2026

Kim has two gold medals and a silver medal to her name, while Lee has won two gold, one silver, and three bronze. That‚Äôs a whopping nine Olympic medals between the two.

MORE: Suni Lee stuns in blue one-piece 2025 SI Swimsuit Issue, talks move to NYC

The two women have been great friends, and along with sharing the Olympic bond, they both proudly represent their Asian ethnicity. Kim was born to South Korean immigrants, while Lee, who was born Sunisa Phabsomphou, is of Hmong descent, and her mother immigrated to the United States from Laos.

It‚Äôs great to see the Olympic champs living their best lives and delivering an aura-filled photo to feed their fans.

title: NFL mock draft: Bucky Brooks has Arizona Cardinals taking Miami OT
description: NFL.com's Bucky Brooks dropped his second mock draft of the year.
fullText:
We are just under two months away from the actual 2026 NFL draft, and the mock drafts have already gotten a bit boring for the Arizona Cardinals, at least in those created by analysts for NFL.com. The Cardinals have the third overall pick in the draft and have several needs, but the recent batch of projections have them going with the same player.

Bucky Brooks published his second mock draft of the year. He has the Cardinals going with an offensive tackle.

With or without Kyler Murray, the Cardinals need to find a tackle to man the right side opposite athletic LT Paris Johnson Jr. Mauigoa is a talented edge blocker with the size, strength and nastiness to bully opponents at the point of attack.

As boring as it sounds, the pick makes sense. The Cardinals have a gaping hole at right tackle and uncertainty at quarterback. Locking down another side of the line will help whoever is starting under center.

It would mark the first time under general manager Monti Ossenfort selects a player outside the Big Ten or SEC in the first or second round of the draft, but the Cardinals recently added two former Miami assistants to their staff.

However, if Ohio State linebacker Arvell Reese is on the board as he is in this mock draft, it will be hard for the Cardinals now to take him, as they also have a huge need for an edge rusher to pair with Josh Sweat.

Also, keep an eye on Ohio State safety Caleb Downs. While safety is not a premium position and Ossenfort would be out of character to go with a safety in the top five, the Cardinals love Ohio State players.

Get more Cardinals and NFL coverage from Cards Wire's Jess Root and others by listening to the latest on the Rise Up, See Red podcast. Subscribe on Spotify,¬†YouTube¬†or¬†Apple podcasts.

title: Christian Horner: Liam Lawson-Yuki Tsunoda swap "wasn't my choice" in 2025
description: Christian Horner says Red Bull‚Äôs early-2025 decision to demote Liam Lawson after just two race weekends and replace him with Yuki Tsunoda was not his call
fullText:
Former Red Bull Racing CEO and team principal Christian Horner has confirmed that it was not his choice to swap Liam Lawson for Yuki Tsunoda at the start of the 2025 Formula 1 season.

It was confirmed at the end of 2024 that Sergio Perez, who had been with the Milton Keynes outfit since 2021, would be replaced by New Zealander Lawson for the 2025 season. Taking the position next to four-time champion Max Verstappen, Lawson competed in just two race weekends before he was demoted to Racing Bulls, with Tsunoda taking his place ahead of the Japanese Grand Prix.

The decision came as a shock, as Lawson only had two grands prix and one sprint race at tracks he had not raced at before to prove himself in the seat. Horner, talking in the upcoming eighth season of Netflix's Drive to Survive, claimed that the decision did not come from him.

"It wasn't my choice. I was always pushed to take drivers from the Young Driver Programme. Helmut was a big driver in it," the Briton said.

After 20 years as Red Bull Racing CEO and team principal, Horner was also replaced in his role by former Racing Bulls team principal Laurent Mekies. "The reality is that for me over the last 20 years, on the good days and the bad days, it's been an epic journey," he reflected.

Following his exit, there have been countless rumours linking Horner to a return to the championship, although nothing has been confirmed at this stage. "I never imagined to be in this position," he added. "Of course, your immediate reaction when you get delivered a s*** sandwich like that is like, f*** them. I've had something taken away from me that wasn't my choice, that was very precious to me."

To read more Motorsport.com articles visit our website.

title: Most wins in World Baseball Classic‚Äô
description: The World Baseball Classic is not just a tournament; it is a high-stakes, emotion-fueled battleground where national pride is on the line with every pitch. Since its inception in 2006, the WBC has delivered some of the most electric, unforgettable‚Ä¶
fullText:
The World Baseball Classic is not just a tournament; it is a high-stakes, emotion-fueled battleground where national pride is on the line with every pitch. Since its inception in 2006, the WBC has delivered some of the most electric, unforgettable moments in the sport‚Äôs history, transforming spring training tune-ups into global spectacles. The tournament brings together the absolute best players on the planet, allowing them to drape their country‚Äôs flag over their shoulders and compete for ultimate bragging rights.

Over the course of five iterations, with the next chapter set to unfold in 2026, certain nations have separated themselves from the pack. They have built dynasties, broken hearts, and consistently found ways to survive the chaotic, sudden-death nature of international tournament play. Some of these countries rely on deep pipelines of MLB superstars, while others lean on established domestic leagues and unmatched team chemistry to topple the heavyweights.

But when the dust settles, the truest measure of a baseball powerhouse is simple: who wins when the lights are brightest? Taking a look at the all-time victory leaderboard heading into the 2026 tournament reveals a fascinating hierarchy of global baseball talent. It highlights the expected juggernauts alongside a few nations that consistently punch above their weight on the international stage.‚Äã

From the passionate fanbases of the Caribbean to the meticulously crafted rosters of Asia and the deep talent pools of North America, here is how the most successful countries in World Baseball Classic history stack up.

Mexico has steadily evolved into a legitimate force on the WBC stage, proving it can hang with anyone in the world. Their unforgettable run to the semifinals in 2023, highlighted by a massive upset over Team USA, proved that their blend of MLB talent and fearless pitching is a recipe for deep tournament runs. They always bring the heat and a passionately loud fan base to the ballpark.‚Äã

Do not let the European flag fool you; the Netherlands is an absolute baseball powerhouse fueled by elite talent from Cura√ßao and Aruba. They have a reputation as the tournament‚Äôs ultimate giant-slayer, most notably breaking Dominican hearts with a pair of stunning walk-off wins in 2009. With a consistently slick-fielding infield and timely hitting, they are a perennial threat to reach the championship rounds.‚Äã

Venezuela‚Äôs rosters always read like an MLB All-Star ballot, loaded with franchise cornerstones and elite sluggers. While they have occasionally struggled to translate that immense on-paper talent into championship hardware, their explosive offense makes them a nightmare matchup. When their pitching staff aligns with their heavy hitters, they are practically unstoppable.

South Korea approaches the WBC with a level of tactical precision and national pride that makes them an incredibly tough out. Their dramatic run to the 2009 final against Japan cemented their status as an elite baseball nation. Armed with contact-heavy lineups and fundamentally flawless defense, they know exactly how to execute in high-pressure situations.

Long considered the boogeymen of international amateur baseball, Cuba‚Äôs rich history in the sport translates beautifully to the WBC. They stormed to the finals in the inaugural 2006 tournament and have consistently remained a threat ever since. Even as the global talent pool has deepened, their aggressive style of play and raw athleticism demand total respect.‚Äã

The Dominican Republic brings a level of swagger and star power to the WBC that is simply unmatched. Their dominant, undefeated run to the 2013 championship remains one of the most impressive feats in tournament history. When this island nation gets rolling, it transforms the stadium into a massive party, fueled by elite pitching and light-tower power.

Despite inventing the game, Team USA took a while to fully figure out the unique rhythm of the World Baseball Classic. They finally broke through to claim the crown in 2017 and followed it up with a thrilling run to the 2023 final. When the American superstars fully buy in, their sheer depth of talent is an overwhelming force of nature.

‚Äã

No team plays with more visible joy, passion, and chemistry than Puerto Rico. They have suffered consecutive heartbreaking defeats in the 2013 and 2017 championship games, but their consistency is undeniably impressive. Famous for their blond hair dye and relentless energy, they are the heartbeat of the tournament and an absolute joy to watch.

Samurai Japan is the undisputed king of the World Baseball Classic, boasting three tournament titles and an unmatched aura of dominance. From Daisuke Matsuzaka‚Äôs heroics in 2006 to Shohei Ohtani‚Äôs epic 2023 strikeout, their WBC history is the stuff of legend. Their incredible fundamental execution and elite pitching depth make them the ultimate gold standard of international baseball.

MORE: Top 10 Winter Olympians of Team USA since 2000

The beauty of the World Baseball Classic lies in its unpredictability, where a single pitch can alter the course of a nation‚Äôs sporting history. While Japan currently sits comfortably on the throne, the gap between the traditional powerhouses and the rest of the world is rapidly closing. As we look ahead to 2026, the stage is set for new rivalries, fresh upsets, and another thrilling chapter in the greatest international baseball showcase on earth.

title: Why Jordan Spieth and Billy Horschel were not happy with the golf course at last year‚Äôs Cognizant Classic
description: The Cognizant Classic is a once-great event that has suffered from PGA Tour changes in recent years. It used to host the very best players on the planet with incredibly talented fields.
fullText:
The Cognizant Classic is a once-great event that has suffered from PGA Tour changes in recent years.

It used to host the very best players on the planet with incredibly talented fields. Tiger Woods famously chased down Rory McIlroy with his best-ever Sunday score, a 62, as McIlroy rose to world number one in 2012.

But its place on the PGA Tour schedule has cost it dearly. The event now takes place after the Pebble Beach Pro-Am and the Genesis Invitational, and before the Arnold Palmer Invitational and The Players, so it‚Äôs a popular event for players to sit out.

What‚Äôs more, a change to PGA National last year drew complaints from a host of PGA Tour stars.

PGA National used to be one of the toughest tests on the PGA Tour. Renovated by Jack Nicklaus, the course features the famous ‚ÄúBear Trap‚Äù on the back stretch, which once struck fear into the hearts of players.

But recent changes, including swapping Bermuda grass for rye to soften fairways and greens, and removing some bunkers, took the teeth out of the course, much to players‚Äô disappointment.

Jordan Spieth said, ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt realize that it was overseeded, and the fairways being overseeded changes it a lot because it‚Äôll make the fairways softer, which makes them wider, and then around the greens it‚Äôs significantly easier than the dormant Bermuda.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre looking at easily a stroke a round on just the change in the grass types in the fairway.‚Äù

Jake Knapp recorded a 59, the 15th sub-60 round in PGA Tour history, but he wasn‚Äôt the only one to go low on Thursday. 115 players were under par in the first round, with 15 of them shooting 65 or better.

Billy Horschel, playing at his hometown event, was also disappointed by the changes, adding, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs just a little disappointing because it‚Äôs such a great test of golf.

‚ÄúI think the overseed has ‚Äì the rough is not long enough. It‚Äôs not penal enough when you miss the fairway. If you had Bermuda rough and Bermuda fairways and if you missed the green you had to chip it off Bermuda instead of overseeded rye, it makes it a little bit tougher.

‚ÄúHopefully, the wind picks up. Hopefully, we see a little bit of PGA National because it is fun playing this golf course when it‚Äôs tough. I think a lot of us do enjoy it.

‚ÄúI really wish we would just play this as a straight Bermuda. From tee to green, everything be straight Bermuda. I know it doesn‚Äôt look prettier on TV and I know that‚Äôs one of the reasons why it‚Äôs overseeded. So it is a little disappointing that ‚Äì I‚Äôd say the condition of the course is very scorable.‚Äù

The changes from last year are still in play in 2026, so expect some low scoring again this weekend.

title: NFL fans react to Nick Sirianni‚Äôs revelation about AJ Brown‚Äôs Philadelphia Eagles future
description: NFL fans have been dissecting Nick Sirianni‚Äôs latest comments about A. J.
fullText:
NFL fans have been dissecting Nick Sirianni‚Äôs latest comments about A.J. Brown after the Philadelphia Eagles head coach stopped short of offering a firm guarantee over the wide receiver‚Äôs future.

Brown remains one of the franchise‚Äôs most important offensive weapons, but uncertainty around next season has sparked debate online.

Sirianni‚Äôs words have only added fuel to that discussion.

Sirianni said via ESPN, ‚ÄúA.J.‚Äôs a great player, and A.J. is a good teammate, and A.J. is a good person. Does he want to be here? Yes. Do I want him to be here? Yes.‚Äù

He continued, ‚ÄúWill A.J. be here next season? I think we‚Äôre still in a spot, like, I can‚Äôt guarantee how anything is going to play out into next season.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm thinking I‚Äôm going to be the coach next season, but you can‚Äôt guarantee anything past tomorrow.‚Äù

The response struck a balanced tone, praising Brown‚Äôs value while acknowledging the unpredictable nature of the NFL.

Contract dynamics, roster construction, and league movement can quickly alter situations, even for star players.

Reactions online ranged from alarm to dismissal. Some supporters immediately interpreted the lack of a guarantee as a warning sign, with one fan posting, ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs gone. Bills for a deuce and Keon!‚Äù Another concluded, ‚ÄúSo basically he won‚Äôt be in the squad for the Eagles next season.‚Äù

Speculation about potential destinations also surfaced. ‚ÄúHard to be an Eagle when he‚Äôs a Patriot,‚Äù one comment read, hinting at divisional drama. Others urged caution, warning that ‚ÄúLetting go of A.J Brown will be a huge mistake.‚Äù

Not everyone saw cause for panic. One fan countered the uproar by saying, ‚ÄúIf anyone spends more than 5 seconds reading this headline, it‚Äôs obvious that they want him in Philly.‚Äù

For now, Sirianni‚Äôs stance suggests mutual interest remains. Whether that translates into long-term certainty will depend on decisions made in the months ahead.

What Saquon Barkley thinks of AJ Brown‚Äôs wink hinting at Patriots move

title: Sergio Perez confident of success with Cadillac despite being one of F1‚Äôs oldest drivers
description: Sergio Perez is returning to the grid this year, joining Cadillac as the team prepares for its first season in Formula 1. His time with Red Bull included highlights like his win at Monaco in 2022, but the partnership ended when both sides grew frustrated with each other.
fullText:
Sergio Perez is returning to the grid this year, joining Cadillac as the team prepares for its first season in Formula 1.

His time with Red Bull included highlights like his win at Monaco in 2022, but the partnership ended when both sides grew frustrated with each other.

Now with a new team, Perez is looking to show he still has plenty to offer. His testing performances have drawn some criticism, but there‚Äôs hope that he‚Äôll find his rhythm once the season starts in Australia.

At 36, Perez is one of the more experienced drivers on the grid and faces the challenge of competing against a younger generation. Still, he believes he can help lead Cadillac‚Äôs early success.

Speaking on the Back at Base podcast, Sergio Perez discussed his year away from F1 and how he plans to adjust this season.

Outlining what he wants from his time with Cadillac, Perez was clear that he expects quick progress and is determined to go all in with the team.

‚ÄúOnce you step out of it and you see it from the outside, you have learned a lot of things. For example, when you are in it, you tend to worry a lot of things that are not representative for the public,‚Äù Perez said. ‚ÄúWhen you have a bad race, you think the world is over. The highs and lows of the sport are extreme. Nothing is going to change on the outside. Just keep enjoying it‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah, I definitely want to go all the way with this team. I want to enjoy the journey with them, and I want to see progress quickly. This is what I‚Äôm here for.‚Äù

Across the garage, Perez‚Äôs Cadillac teammate Valtteri Bottas is also looking to reset, treating his first season with the team as a chance to reset and approach the sport with a new mindset.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs like a comeback. I‚Äôve really approached the sport now with a different view of the sport, with more respect to the sport, more respect to the staff or the team members.‚Äù

Bottas has his sights set on making this season one of personal growth: ‚ÄúI want to make it the best season I‚Äôve had, personally. I want to give it all to myself, but first of all to the team. So if I can finish next year with a feeling that there was nothing I could have done better, that is a good goal.‚Äù

Jolyon Palmer says not a ‚Äòsingle aspect‚Äô of Adrian Newey‚Äôs 2026 Aston Martin is working

Franz Tost backs Oscar Piastri to challenge Max Verstappen for 2026 F1 title

Will Buxton believes Ferrari‚Äôs 180-degree rear wing could be a game-changer in 2026 title fight
